Reviews.Title: “Nice but....”
Reviews.Author: seortega1977
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed at your hotel from the 8th till the 13th. Great Location, but you cleaning staff needs some serious addressing. We had stuff taken from our rooms, (we had connecting rooms). we had stuff moved, I don't mean like a little I mean moved about the room. Our furniture had major stains, carpet was real dirty. Brought this to the front desk staffs attention. We were told they would let us know something about our missing stuff and never got a response back. I will say the guys out front and the majority of the front desk staff were wonderful. But we had issues that were ignored and well I'm already looking into staying somewhere else when I go back because I can't trust the housekeeping staff at all.

Reviews.Title: “Okay”
Reviews.Author: DEAinATL
Reviews.Content: Plus: the rooms were quite large and pleasant. The parking is valet and we took the car out every day - and the valets got it there fast. Minus: Breakfast was pretty lame. Although the coffee was excellent, the eggs were powdered, really inedible, actually inexplicable. There was pork sausage but no hash browns/grits/etc. The pastries were also pretty bad. One morning I requested an extra chair for the room and the repair of the broken hairdryer and was told "right away." Upon our return 10 hours later neither had been addressed.

Reviews.Title: “Super spot for French Quarter and Street Car”
Reviews.Author: WoodsHoleJim
Reviews.Content: This was the ideal spot for our 4 days over New Years for our family of 4 (2 daughters in college).. It is close to the French Quarter (one block) and on the street car line. The hotel is unusual for a Hampton Inn because it has enormous room size and high ceilings and huge windows. All the rest is the reliable Hampton with healthy breakfasts. The staff were helpful and the celebrations on the river were just an 8 minute walk away. Also it is away from the New Orleans Convention center which is nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TSwish
Reviews.Content: Very close to everything - Bourbon street is just a block away. Our room was very nice - the staff was friendly. Would stay again (and hope to).

Reviews.Title: “St. Paddy's Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: molly062
Reviews.Content: Stayed in New Orleans over the St. Patrick's Day weekend. Picked this hotel for price and location.Felt this was an okay choice. You should be aware there are less than desirable street people in the nearby area, however once we hit Canal Street (two blocks away) things were fine. Big rooms, okay breakfast and steep parking fee ($30.00 per day) Pleasant staff. Convenient location to French Quarter and streetcar stop is nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: MSquared007
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for the NCAA Final Four.......and this property was the perfect spot for our stay. Stay here and you are within walking distance of everything.....Superdome, Bourbon Street (only 1 1/2 blocks away) and the French Quarter, French Market, Riverwalk and the Convention Center. The rooms are spacious and include a huge flat screen TV, refridgerator, microwave and a safe. They also offer fee breakfast and free wireless internet. Book this hotel for your next stay in the Big Easy and you will not be disappointed!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, pretty good value”
Reviews.Author: luvs2run27
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by this hotel. I'm not sure if I was upgraded as an Hilton Honors member, but my room was enormous. Very comfortable as well. I also took advantage of the complimentary breakfast and fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms and clean.”
Reviews.Author: alwayshavingfun11
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a must! It is directly across Canal Street from the French Quarter so it is much less expensive than the other hotels. You also don't get the noise from the all night partying. The rooms are very spacious and you get free breakfast. Shortly after checking in, the hotel called our room to make sure it was to our liking. I was impressed. The hotel offers government rates which is greatly appreciated. That saved us so much money especially since weekend rates go sky high in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favorite Hampton Inn for sure.”
Reviews.Author: Daficionado
Reviews.Content: I'm a big fan of Hampton Inns - in fact, when given the chance I will typically stay there if I am paying as I find they are clean and comfy for the money. I also love my Hilton Honors Rewards. :) HOWEVER....this one did not really make the mark for me. While the management was very accommodating in trying to fix a bad situation (I will not get into details but it was pretty bad), I can say that I would not feel comfortable staying in this property again. My concerns are mainly cleanliness and front desk attitude. The positives of the hotel are location - the beginning and end of the street car line is 2 blocks away which is very convenient. Its only a few minute's walk to the French Quarter, and Carondelet Street turns into Bourbon Street on the other side of Canal Street. The breakfast room is quite nice, the fitness room has a wide variety of equipment, although some machines are dated and in need of repair. Just not up to the standards of a typical Hampton Inn. I would opt for the Garden District Hampton Inn if I were to visit NOLA again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the sights in the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Jim F
Reviews.Content: Short walk to Bourbon St and the French Quarter-elevator security , so a badge needed to get to rooms-nice morning breakfast-clean rooms-wi/fi access-quiet (which you will appreciate if you survived Bourbon St)

Reviews.Title: “A very Good choice for New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Sail2fun
Reviews.Content: Located two block from the French Quarter and Bourbon Street without the noise and crowds. The hotels location is Excellent. The rooms were clean and good sized. Include a fridge and coffee pot and free buffett breakfast. The staff was friendly and knowledgeable amking great recommendations for restrauants and local attractions. I am staying here the next time I visit New Orleans. Book early, and the rates are very attractive considering the Great location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tlk824Pa
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn was clean, very large rooms, excellent service and staff. Breakfast buffet was great. Our room not only had 2 beds, but a couch, table, desk, microwave, fridge and coffee pot along with a large tv. The price was very reasonable It was an easy walk to all the action, but hotel was in a quiet area, so it was away from the noise. Only issue with that was the street to get to it was a little creepy at night. It was just 2 blocks off Canal street, so a short walk, but it was dark street. .That is the only reason I did not give it a 5 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: revpar77
Reviews.Content: Comfortable but casual property. Located two blocks from the edge of the French Quarter on Carondelet Street (which becomes Bourbon Street) and two blocks from Poydras Avenue and about 4 blocks from the Superdome area. Unfortunately, the one block walk to Canal Street forces you to pass in front of a couple seedy food shops and a tattoo parlor full of undesireables hanging out both inside and out front, including homeless persons. Friendly front desk personnel. We had a corner King whirlpool room, very large room with tall windows and ceilings. Very comfortable. Large breakfast area on the 4th floor. Food is okay, except the inedible concoction they try and pass off as scrambled eggs. They are cold, tasteless, and broken up in inedible bits that you can't even use a fork to scoop and eat. Really bad. And they serve this poisen every other day (we stayed for 7 days and it was served 3 times during our stay. Yuck!) This hotel needs to serve more sausage, bacon and ham like other Hampton Inns. Complementary newspaper delivery to your room every weekday morning. Only one computer for guest use located on 4th floor. Aside from the bellman/doorman breaking the feet on our suitcase(unintentionally of course) this was a hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: ridger500
Reviews.Content: The hotel is only 2 blocks from the French quarter and a very easy walk. We were out walking day and night and had no worries. It is far enough away from the action that you don't hear all the noise, but close enough you can go to your room and rest when you get tired. Will stay here again next time we visit New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Nice People, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: vegasrob
Reviews.Content: Nice property. The people are very helpful. Have stayed here several times. Internet works well. Easy to get to all the many restaurants and fun spots of the French Quarter. Quiet. I would have preferred a room with a view of something other than a brick wall - but not a real big deal.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!! - Great!”
Reviews.Author: Nichiel
Reviews.Content: I normally drive home to Texas during the holidays and this time instead of driving straight in, I decided to stop over in the N.O. since that's a halfway point from Atlanta. I found the Hampton Inn via my AAA membership. This was in December during a college football event which I was totally unaware of and somehow I got a room for a great price that was sold out! (Yaaay Me!) It is just a quick stroll from the French Quarters, great location! The valet parking is right in front of the doors, you pull up give the valet your keys, the bell man whisks right out and puts your luggage on the cart and walks with you to check-in and then walks you to your room (well worth the tip). The parking is included in the hotel bill, which as those that travel to the N.O. know that normally you have to pay separately cash, so the parking was great. However, i did notice that the parking garage that hampton uses is also self-parking for $10 versus hampton's $30 valet charge. But hey, for the service and convenience I got, I'll pay the extra $20. The room was a very nice size, the beds were amazingingly comfortable and I'm a shower/water pressure fan and that was GLORIUS! The bathroom was roomy, the view was awesome! I had a great time!! AND they had my bigelow tea, oh yes the breakfast available for the guests was nice! The tip (i found out the hard way after i balanced items for 2) is to the your tray that your ice bucket and cups are on so that you can put your food items on there and not look like you're auditioning for the circus. LOL! Overall i had a WONderful time and got a chance to introduce a "friend" to the N.O. for the first time and there WILL be a 2nd time! I'm planning as I type. :-)) Stay here! You'll enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Memorable service”
Reviews.Author: BornTooLoose
Reviews.Content: I left some sweaters in a drawer when we checked out---when I telephoned later the staff was most agreeable and returned my sweaters speedily. That kind of service made the whole experience positive. One of the better Hamptons we've encountered, and our salute to the extremely courteous staff.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn on Carondelet was very nice”
Reviews.Author: kickie10
Reviews.Content: The rooms were huge, and they had our group set up in adjoining rooms before we even asked for them! All the people were super nice & helpful, the rooms were spotless, maid service was unobtrusive but on time. Location is great if you want to see mardi gras parades and have quick access to the French Quarter. About a block and a half from Canal (parades), streetcar stop right outside hotel, cross canal street and you are on Bourbon. Valet parking got our car there quickly, so quickly we weren't ready yet! Would definately stay here again. One of my favorite hotels in New Orleans, especially for the price.

Reviews.Title: “So Close, but quiet...”
Reviews.Author: ss309556
Reviews.Content: About 2 blocks from the French Quarter and Bourbon Street ,but far enough to miss the noise when the work is done and the day is over. Free Breakfast that is better than average. It backs up to an inside mall for lunch and work needs. 4th floor is the floor to be on. Service People are nice, very happy it is part of the Hilton chain.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tamaria
Reviews.Content: Walking distance to Canal/Bourbon but away from the noise. We left another hotel early due to problems and as this was my second choice we moved here. The room was nice, not much of a view from our room though. Room had a safe, microwave and refrigerator and anything else you may need for your trip. If you didn't bring something the front desk was well stocked with items. Loved the fact that you needed a key to access the elevators. The buffet was ok, no meats available, unlike other Hampton's I've stayed, but still ok. The bathroom was in need of remodeling/updating but other than that it was a nice, spacious room. The maid service was great and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, friendly”
Reviews.Author: Stevo1223
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to the French Quarter as well as many of the city's finest restaurants. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Restaurants and Bourbon Street”
Reviews.Author: WxmanMD
Reviews.Content: Only 2 blocks to beginning of Bourbon Street. Need Keys to enter elevators to rooms which is a good security feature when downtown in a major city. Excellent breakfast buffet and exercise room. I was here for business but plan to return with wife for vacation soon. During day you can exit through office building with food options.

Reviews.Title: “A Unique Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Glenngpr
Reviews.Content: The architecture of this building is very un-Hampton. The hotel is housed in a 1940s era brownstone that could have served as an office building or asylum in its previous life. One can easily envision Dashiell Hammett characters wandering through the lobby. The location is terrific, just a block-and-a-haIf from Canal Street. New Orleans remains one of the most distinct, and in fact, coolest, of American cities. This Hampton Inn offers a great location, free wireless, decent breakfast, and a unique ambience for the visitor to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location to walk in any direction”
Reviews.Author: SouthernWoman55
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn/Downtown is the perfect location to walk to the French Quarter, Harrods and the Superdome.....We were there for two nights for the National Championship Football Game, Jan 8-9, 2012..... We were greeted with snacks at the frontdesk at check-in and found our room nice and clean...... This Hampton appears to be an older hotel at one time but Hampton Inn has done a nice job in undating. Hopefully, the repairs that are needed from other reviews will be taken care of...we did not have that problem. The continental breakfast was more than just muffins, bagels but added with eggs, french toast too....Very nice.... We will definitely stay here again for the perfect location....

Reviews.Title: “Great location, convenient parking, clean, wonderful breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: pandtheb
Reviews.Content: As noted in previous reviews, the hotel is just a couple easy walking blocks to the French Quarter. We were greeted by the most helpful and friendly valet. Enjoyed the delicious complimentary cookie during our check in, and were more then surprised at our gorgeous street side corner room. The trolley does pass right in front of the hotel and we could hear it but it did not bother us. We were glad we were just steps away from the boarding area. It was $1.25 when we were there and you needed to have correct change. Lots of locals use the trolley system for transportation and we enjoyed chatting with them about their lively city. New Orleans reminded me more of a Caribbean port then any other US city I have visited. We walked to Bourbon Street around 8:30 am, took about 10 minutes, and still found plenty of activity taking place without all the partying crowds. The French Quarter area has very narrow streets, lots of pedestrians and intersecting streets. I cannot imagine trying to navigate it as a tourist in an SUV. Lastly the included breakfast buffet at the hotel was wonderful. The room is large and the staff could not possibly have been any nicer. It consisted of the typical Hampton Inn breakfast choices, waffles, eggs, cereal, pastries, but the service, how well stocked, and how clean the area was really put it above the others (mostly Marriott's) I have seen. Our stay at Hampton Inn on Carondelet is certainly one we will highly recommend but ask for a room away from the road if you are sensitive to street noise.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: JSinDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New Orleans from Dec 26 - 28, 2011. This was a family trip, and so we had four adults in one queen suite at the Hampton Inn - Downtown and we absolutely loved it. The room was clean and spacious and the hotel staff was pleasant. Plus, booking through the website around that time, we got a deal on the rooms that included parking, so it was well worth the money. But, more importantly, if you are looking for something that is an easy walk to both the streetcars (the Canal and St. Charles lines) and the French Quarter, than consider staying here. This was our first time in the city and we found it very convenient to get around without the car. If we're in New Orleans again, we will definitely book with this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Buyers Beware! Check the Cancellation Policy for this Property.”
Reviews.Author: Ken M
Reviews.Content: This is the only Hilton property in New Orleans that if you want to cancel, you must do so 30 days prior to arrival to avoid cancellation penalties. The Best Rate is basically an "Advance Purchase".

Reviews.Title: “Wow'ed by the experience”
Reviews.Author: amm9179
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans often for business & pleasure but this experience was for my husband & I's wedding anniversary. We were saving money to build a house but still wanted to get away for the weekend. So we were pleasently surprised by the value of this hotel. We booked a King size room but since I had told them we were there for our anniversary, they gave us a corner room. It was AMAZING!! The staff was happy & helpful. Of all the hotels that I've stayed in Nola, I was most impressed with this one. I guess it was probably because I wasn't expecting much & it turned out to be excellent. We had a wonderfully comfortable bed & a very spacious bathroom. The view wrapped the entire room. Falling asleep to the wonderful skyline of new orleans is almost as visually appealing than waking up to it. I didn't hear noise from the streets or noise in the halls. It was a really nice experience & I will be staying there again, in fact I will be recommending it to several friends as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Customer Service, Wonderful Location, Fast Valet Service, Very Clean, Nice Breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: Carla W
Reviews.Content: Thirteen of my family members, with very different needs, descended upon the Hampton Inn last weekend for the Louisiana High School Football State Championship Games. First, the customer service was outstanding. The team was nice enough to put 5 hotel rooms next to each other, so that were all together. When one of the party's plane was delayed and they didn't make it until the next morning, the staff didn't charge us for that night. When I needed to add-on Saturday night, they did it at my current price when they could have charged much more. "Brian" was very patient and provided daily recommendations and directions for my older Mom and her friend. (Bless him!) The location was about half way between the Superdome and Jackson Square, and two blocks off of Bourbon, so something for everyone. At checkout, our car was ready in five minutes while friends at other hotels waited an hour and a half. The rooms were clean; the beds comfortable. Mom and her friend insisted on eating breakfast their instead of going out in the mornings. I have found where I will stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Two blocks from being excellent and two from the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Ortwin
Reviews.Content: This Hampton Inn is as they usual are. The location is more than okay as it is crawling distance from the French Quarter. It is located in one of the oldest buildings in the district, which is also a bit its negative side. The lobby is small and in a shopping mall - good for a warm by-pass when it is cold, but not so nice. They have a large and cosy breakfast at the 4th should you want something more nice to meer people. Rooms are sufficiently large and well maintained, thoug a bit old. Good housekeeping and other services. However, they say they are green for your towels, but every night a lot off lights are on in your room (not to mention the aircon when I arrive, freezing cold!). Complementary breakfast can be crowdy as all have to get food around relatively small island at the entrance of the breakfast room. This is a good Hampton Inn, but that's what it is.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice Hampton in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: RXgirlMO
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice Hampton - just a few blocks from the French Quarter. Good size rooms, great breakfast and very clean. There is added security for floors with guest rooms as you have to have a key to get to them on the elevator. It is valet parking so be prepared - but they are very quick and courteous. I've stayed in some "high class" hotels that weren't this nice and accommodating. Good price and good location. Only a few small cons: the beds are ok - but a little hard, the shower pressure was average, and being on the street side, there were sirens at night (but nothing too terribly bad). I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “My worst Hampton Inn so far”
Reviews.Author: Gone2room
Reviews.Content: I reserved at the Hampton Inn based on previous experience with the Brand and on the reviews from tripadvisor. The entrance of the hotel is far from those of other HIs I have stayed at. We got our rooms on the 4th floor, which is convenient to the breakfast buffet (on same floor), but rooms very very dirty. Floor was sticky. They came and vacuumed it, but obviously, the sticky filth, does not go away with a vacuum. We did not take our shoes off for the whole night. Size of the rooms was much smaller than at other Hampton Inns. Bathroom, too basic, again, not in line with the brand. Bed was good, as in most Hampton Inns. Breakfast was in line with other places, and attendant was there to pick up and re-stock. We ended up leaving just after one night, and booked at another hotel. Upon check out, the front desk clerk/manager, did not even ask why we were leaving before our scheduled date. She probably knew how bad those rooms were. Perhaps a higher floor, street facing room may be ok, and those may be bigger rooms as well. Location is just next to the French Quarter and Canal street, without being directly where the noise is. Other than that, a hotel well overrated. Price wise, you can get a room at the Marriott, the JW or other full service hotels for same rate, just a couple of blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelingASAP
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel in New Orleans. Issac the manager greeted us with a warm welcome! He also gave us great directions to Bourbon Street, French Quarter, and other tourist sights. All the staff at this hotel were friendly and helpful. They also allowed us late checkout as our flight was in the late afternoon. It's an older hotel but very clean. The only suggestion would be to re-do the bathrooms. Our bathroom was showing some signs of age with worn faucets, laminate counters and an older tub/shower enclosure. Otherwise, the bedding was fresh and clean and the carpets in fine shape. The breakfast bar on the 4th floor was never crowded and had a nice selection of fruits, cereal, breads, egg dishes, coffee and juice. There is also a computer with a printer for ease of printing boarding passes on the 4th floor. It is ideally located to all the tourist sights and you can catch the trolley about a block down the street for $1.25. Bourbon Street is about 3 blocks and Harrahs Casino about 5 blocks away. (Bourbon St is a little crazy after midnight...) If you have time visit the WW2 museum, it's fascinating and as good as any Smithsonian Museum. We had a great time at this Hampton Inn and would definately return. No complaints from us!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: bazzsm
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Hampton Inn and it was GREAT. The staff was very professional and friendly. We were there attending the Bayou Classic and this hotel is within walking distance to the Superdome, Harrah's, Shopping and Bourbon Street. The staff was very helpful in giving us directions. Also the cookies at the front desk was very good. The breakfast was good and there was a good variety of items. My room was clean and very comfortable. I received a call from the front desk inquiring about the room and if I was satisfied. My experience was very good and I plan to stay there whenever I go to New Orleans. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Our Trip to Naw-lins!”
Reviews.Author: Tina-Marie1962
Reviews.Content: we spent 3 nights last weekend (11/19 to 11/22). Our room was on the top floor and we loved it. yes, we had the not great bathroom, but it was still very clean, plenty of towels, comfy. Our check-in was at 7pm, and we were greeted by Isaac, the GSA and Latrinda Cooper, the manager on duty. It was the most warming and friendly greeting by the staff. Isaac informed me that although our stay was booked on points and free, that they "hooked me up" with a great room. He did not lie: we loved it! Yes, the hotel is older, but who cares? This is still a terrific place to stay, and very comfortable. We are already planning another trip in November 2012, and I am sure it will be as full as this one was. stay here: you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Location great, Hotel and Staff good, Room ok”
Reviews.Author: taprennoc
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights here while working and sight seeing. Hotel location is great. If you have a car you won't need it much or at all unless you leave the French quarter. You can walk pretty much anywhere in the quarter from here. Parking is about 26$ nightly so save the money unless you have to have a car. Hotel common areas are quite nice. Updated and quite clean. Staff very friendly and helpful with suggestions on restaurants, etc. the room though felt dated and in Ned of some updating, sprucing up, and a good scrub down. Bathroom had a walk in shower which I love but the shower head was useless. It sprayed all over the place. No shelves to put shampoos or soaps. Floor was a bit dingy. Bed was comfy enough, blast was standard Hampton fare. I'd probably go back but with some new furniture and cleaning itd be perfect for a trip to the city. As a diamond member with Hilton's I have seen the best and some of the worst of Hamptons, and I'd say this one falls in the middle.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Weekend”
Reviews.Author: paul j
Reviews.Content: My wife and I met up with friends for a fun weekend in NOLA and stayed at this Hampton Inn property on Carondolet. The location is excellent, one block off Canal and the Quarter. It is close enough to the action, but far enough way to get a great night's sleep. We had a king with sitting area in a corner room. The bed was incredibly comfortable, the shower was nice and hot, and there was ample room. The staff was also fantastic. The level of service was comparable to what I would expect at top-end Hilton properties. The valet was $30, but that is to be expected in the city. They were prompt every time we needed the car and always helpful with directions. If you are mainly going to stay in the Quarter on your trip, I would recommend NOT renting a car and take a $33 cab ride (each way) from MSY and walk or take the trolley around the city.

Reviews.Title: “Tired Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JEM4100
Reviews.Content: Chose this Hampton Inn on Carondelet because it's two blocks to Bourbon Street. The hotel provides a good room for the money, excellent breakfast. Our room was a "king study with sofa". It was large with flat-screen TV, one sink, one three-drawer chest, and a sofa-bed that Goodwill likely would not accept. Housekeeping was slow and unresponsive, the room was dimly lit. Overall, the place felt "tired".

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: CaptainRonn
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews before booking this Hampton Inn. Some were all praise; some were a bit brutal. Based on the location and the many compliments of the staff, we booked a room for one night after arriving in New Orleans from a trans-atlantic cruise. As previously stated by others, the staff were friendly, professional, helpful, and knowledgable about New Orleans. We arrived early (9:30a.m.) and checked in. A room was not ready, so Bryan, a super nice and cheerful bellhop, securely stored our luggage while we set out to wander the Quarter. We returned around 2:30p.m. and retired to our room for a rest from a lot of walking. The room was a standard room with a king bed which was quite comfortable. Our view was of the building next door. I imagine that is basically the view from any room due to the location among other high rise buildings. Yes, the furniture did show some signs of wear with a few dings and dents. However, it was nothing monumental. We enjoyed having a flat screen TV, a microwave and a refrigerator in the room. The bathtub surround showed some age and discoloration; but again, truly nothing worth complaining about. The breakfast offerings were quite good and had a multitude of choices; eggs, sausage, gravy, fruit, yogurt, cereal, etc.. The afternoon cookies were a nice treat also. All in all, a really good night's stay in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “4 words - Feces on bathroom wall; 4 more words - Staff Did Not Fix”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: You read that correctly. I reported several problems with the bathroom: 1) Feces on the wall 2) Water is SCALDING hot 3) Toilet doesn't work After several calls, NONE of these were addressed or rectified. I had to personally use one of their towles and clean off the feces from the bathroom wall. Terrible service. Stayed two nights. They refunded one night. I am still NOT happy. NOLA was great. I love this city. This hotel was very poor.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have chosen a better location”
Reviews.Author: HappyWanderer023
Reviews.Content: A downtown hotel in an old, but well-kept building, the location is perfect for tourists. A two-block walk to the French Quarter, yet far enough away to avoid the noise, especially at night. The old green St. Charles Avenue streetcar stops less than half a block away, making for an easy trip to the Garden District or the (not-to-be-missed) National World War II Museum. Two blocks from the hotel is Canal Street, where the red Canal Street streetcar can take you to the waterfront (Aquarium, Imax theater, Harrah's casino, the waterfront mall and cruise ship terminal), and a transfer to the Riverfront Streetcar gets you to the convention center or the French Market. As for the hotel itself, we had a corner room that was huge and a bath to match (the latter could use a renovation, but that's the only minor negative thing I can think of). We particularly appreciated the quiet, efficient heating/AC, another thing that's important for a good night's sleep but is often lacking, especially in older buildings. Add a flat-screen TV with lots of cable channels, terrific bedding, and solid wi-fi, and it's hard to think of anything that is missing. The place was simply comfortable -- and comforting -- after returning from a hard day of sightseeing. We spent five nights and actually looked forward to returning to the room every day. As with all Hamptons, a free buffet breakfast is included and this was one of the better ones we've encountered. In addition to the usual assortment of cold items, there were two hot dishes each day. One was usually either scrambled eggs, a cheese omelet, or french toast sticks, and the other was sausage, turkey sausage or ham, though one morning it was biscuits and gravy. The usual fruit cocktail was supplemented with fresh bananas and apples, which we particularly welcomed. The service in the breakfast room was outstanding: nothing was left unreplenished for long and the trash cans were emptied promptly. And that brings me to my last comment: the staff, both at breakfast and on the front desk, were really friendly and exceptionally helpful. All in all, a terrific stay at a very reasonable price. I'll gladly recommend this hotel to any friends visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: OldWandererAz
Reviews.Content: This is a great location for visiting New Orleans French Quarter, Riverwalk, Casino, Riverboat rides, Aquarium and many other attractions. All of the attractions that I mentioned are within an easy walk. The cruise ship terminal is walkable, or a short taxi ride from the hotel. The hotel is in an older building, nicely renovated, clean with large rooms. Breakfast was very good. Staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't ask for a better location, close but far enough away.”
Reviews.Author: scice
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were headed to New Orleans for a quick 3 night visit in early November and wanted something close to everything, but far enough away to get some rest too. This was the perfect location. We took a cab from the airport, about a 25 minute trip and cost a set rate of $33 plus tip. The hotel is on Carondelet Street, which two blocks later across Canal Street, turns in Bourbon Street (and a whole other world from where you are staying). The lobby is somewhat strange as the hotel is connected to a mall with a clothing store located in the lobby. The front desk is actually in the back past the elevators. We arrived a little after 1 PM with a 3 PM check-in. Our room wasn't ready, no big deal, they stored our bags and we went out. I left my cell number and they said they'd call when the room was ready. Well, 3 PM came and went and we still got no call. We eventually showed back up about 3:15 and after what seemed to be some confusion behind the desk, we were given our room keys. As a Hilton Honors Silver member, usually I would get a snack bag or water, but here my status was never mentioned (not sure why not, I await my survey from Hilton). Anyway, our room was on the 4th floor, which also is the floor that breakfast is served on, so that was convenient. The room itself was clean, with a nice HD flatscreen. The bathroom was kinda cramped, with a shower stall that had almost painfully strong water pressure (never thought I'd say too much pressure). Our view was of a giant brick wall, not a big deal to me, just a warning to anyone expecting something different. The room had a fridge and microwave, which came in handy. The breakfast changed daily from scrambled eggs, omlettes, sausage, etc. Cereal, fruit, bagels and waffles were available daily. The coffee bar is always open, as with all Hampton's, so that is a plus. The St. Charles streetcar stops one block away from the hotel and you can take a nice tour of the Garden District on this for $1.25 each way (we took it to Commander's Palace without any issues). The hotel is within walking distance of most anything you could want to do in the French Quarter, and in a location where the noise of Bourbon Street is far enough away.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: mrsshep
Reviews.Content: Our room was fantastic, had a corner room on the 7th floor. Very spacious and loved the Hampton bed!!! Desk staff were fantastic with helping us set up a Swamp Tour. Very short and safe walk to Bourbon St. I loved that our room had 2 full walls of windows.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: drewantha
Reviews.Content: Old but renovated hotel about 2 blocks from The French Quarter. Valet parking at about $26. a day.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value in Great Location”
Reviews.Author: mvbruner
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 1 night at the Hampton Inn - New Orleans Downtown for a wedding recently. The hotel is about 2 blocks from Canal Street and Bourbon Street. Great Location. The room itself was clean, quiet and comfortable. I would definitely recommend anyone coming to New Orleans to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Nawlins' Nice”
Reviews.Author: DaveEB310
Reviews.Content: Traveled to New Orleans to hang with an old buddy for some food, drink, fun, and Saints football this past weekend. Due to a Super Bowl Rematch, the game was predicted to be a big one (although Peyton didnâ€™t play so it was an all out rout by the hometown team) so all the hotels in the French Quarter were sold out. Because of this, my buddy found this Hampton Inn about 2 blocks away from Bourbon Street and the Quarter. Have to say, it turned out to be a fairly nice choice. The hotel was close enough to walk in the absolutely beautiful weather and take in the city, but far enough away to enjoy some much needed peace and quiet allowing us to decompress a bit from the action before we would venture out and tackle it again. The breakfast area was quite large and found on the 4th floor of this old, but kept, building. Offerings were abundant and the food quite good. Our room was large and the beds comfortable, but as my buddy said, and I agree with him, â€œthe bathroom is pretty tired for a Hampton Inn.â€� It definitely needed an update and some refreshing. We received complementary Dasani Waters and Snickers in our room. And of course, had we forgotten any toiletries, the front desk would have supplied complimentary. All in all, a nice stay in a fun town. Additionally, we easily grabbed a cab at 6:30 am on a Monday morning and were at the Airport in 20 minutes time. So, location wise, itâ€™s decent one. Looking forward now to a Hampton Stay in Chicago. Great job Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Me”
Reviews.Author: SingleTraveler98
Reviews.Content: I recently spent a week's vacation in New Orleans and enjoyed my stay at the Hampton Inn Downtown/French Quarter. The hotel is two blocks away from the French Quarter, which was perfect for me because of its location in an area less "lively" than the French Quarter. The hotel's rooms are fairly large since the hotel seems to be located in a restored office building. The room had the usual Hampton Inn amenities (coffee maker, microwave, refrigerator, HD television, etc.) along with an in-room safe. The front desk staff was helpful and courteous. They phoned me twice during my week-long stay to be sure everything in the room was satisfactory. The guys out front seemed more interested in talking with each other than in helping me with my bags. The breakfast buffet consists of the usual Hampton Inn breakfast items and is served in a large room. I never had a problem finding a seat in the breakfast room. I have no regrets for staying here and would do so again. The hotel is right along the St. Charles streetcar line, and Carondelet Street becomes Bourbon Street as it enters the French Quarter two short blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “All that jazz”
Reviews.Author: TwoofOz
Reviews.Content: Excellent reception service quickly set the standard for a wonderful few days in New Orleans. Location? Step outside the front doors and hear the music of Bourbon Street, just a couple of minutes away. This is a very comfortable hotel which served excellent breakfasts and provided very sound advice to a couple of inexpert travellers. The place to stay for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful, inexpensive place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: spillersm
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Carondelet Street, which is just across from Bourbon Street in the French QUarter. We booked a smoking room but there was no evidence of previous people smoking, THe room and hallways were always clean and smelled good. The breakfast was wonderful and had plenty of food. The staff was beyond friendly. Issac, the clerk was a great wealth of information. I'm don't know the name of the woman who was working on October 1, but managment should give her a pin that says she's the most cheerful person alive. She was nice and helpful. I love this place.

Reviews.Title: “New Orleans 2011”
Reviews.Author: Ready2go63
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise. We were prepared for the worst for the hotel room and ended up being very happy. The room was small, but clean. And this is what matters the most to me. It was just a two block walk to the French Quarter. We were advised not to walk from the French Quarter after dark, but we went back to room fairly early and went ahead a walked. Never had any trouble. They also offered a breakfast that was pretty decent. We will stay here again if we get the chance to go back......and the price was excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: TrishaBishop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights during our tour of the Southern States. It is nice that it has maintained the character of the surrounding area. Our room (908) was more like a suite with sofa, kingsize bed, flat screen TV, fridge, microwave and safe. The room had really large windows which is a characteristic of of this older type of building which is something I particularly like. It was a really lovely room and the aircon worked well without being too noisey. The location is perfect - a couple of blocks from all the action. You may pass a beggar or too along the way but they are not troublesome. The complimentary breakfast was lovely. Fresh fruit salad, yoghurts and a selction of pastries - you need a balance! When you walk in the lobby it feels more like walking into a shopping centre than a hotel which I found alittle odd, but you don't really spend much time in the lobby anyway. New Orleans is a great place and if I get the opportunity to return I would definitely look up this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel-Need dresser”
Reviews.Author: gwmeyer31
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel in a great location very close to Bourbon Street. If you are staying more than 1 night and want to unpack your suitcase, make sure you ask for a room with a dresser. Not all rooms have one. They have a great breakfast and a managerâ€™s dinner (on Wednesdays). They have good local food and wine/beer. This place is a steal and very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: tharisicia
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a 4 day 3 night stay at the Hampton Inn. After reading some of the previous reviews we were a little leary but couldn't beat the proximity and price. We are extremely glad we stayed. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean, comfortable and VERY spacious. The distance from the "action" was extremely close (well within walking distance) however once we returned to the hotel it seemed like we were miles away. The breakfast was fantastic. Would recommend to others and will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a good location.”
Reviews.Author: JDeston
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans 3-4 times a year and have stayed in numerous hotels. This trip my friends and I chose the Hampton out of necessity as most other hotels in our price range, near the French Quarter, were booked during JazzFest. We were all pleasantly surprised. The rooms are extremely roomy. The hotel is in a good location. It is only a couple of blocks from Bourbon and Canal Street. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful when we had questions. The hotel was clean. The linens were nice and the area was extremely quiet. I would stay here again as long at the rate was reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “overall, a good value”
Reviews.Author: trvlgrlsanjose_CaUSA
Reviews.Content: I got an Internet rate of $99 per night which included valet parking. The location was good and the place was quiet. I could not hear people in other rooms. I thought the free breakfast was better than most and included both hot and cold items. there was a little mold in the shower and the room had a slight musty smell, but I think that may be common in a place that is so humid all the time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel - great location - great staff - I stay here all the time”
Reviews.Author: goalgirl66
Reviews.Content: I stay here every other month for business and I can always count on it being an enjoyable stay. The location is great and convenient for walking around the French Quarter or you can jump on the St. Charles street car only a block away. The hotel is clean and comfortable. The internet is complimentary and works great - fast connection speed and never had a problem. The gym is small but adequate and I always get there early in the morning so it's not a problem to get what I need in but it is very small. The complimentary breakfast is good and there are tons of choices and a big room to sit and enjoy while you read the paper. Valet is fast and they have good rates for park and stay packages that makes their parking much cheaper than other hotels. Plus, there are free cookies at night at the front desk and free breakfast to go bags at the front desk in the morning if you are just running out. The staff is also knowledable about local eateries and will call for take out for you as well. I recommend this hotel to anyone and of the 6 stays here in the past 11 months, I have always had a nice stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, large clean room for a good price!”
Reviews.Author: buckcalif
Reviews.Content: When I read negative reviews about a place that I just stayed at, I often wonder if it is the same hotel. I had no problems at all and was pleasantly surprised at how nice this property really was. While I do prefere to have real glasses and coffee cups the price which included the daily hot breakfast was worth it all to me.

Reviews.Title: “I Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: guitarbobsd
Reviews.Content: When I come to New Orleans I always try to stay here. For the money it is a great value. The entire staff makes your experience special. thanks

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting...”
Reviews.Author: watsac
Reviews.Content: This is the most disgusting Hilton property I've stayed in over the past 15 years. The bathroom is old, filthy and in major need of repairs (see attached photos) and the entire room reeks of an odor which is an interesting blend of mold, cheap perfume and cigarettes.

Reviews.Title: “Takes top honors on our list of best hotels we've ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: RubyDragonfly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel one night before our cruise the next day. We had family who had booked rooms here, too, and would arriving at various times. We arrived at the hotel and noticed the entrance and seating areas are tidy and clean. Later, since our group's rooms were on various floors and we went to each in order to talk to, pick up, or drop off people, we noticed that the hallways and area in front of the elevators were clean and well-kept. We were quickly checked in, told about the necessity of the keycard in order to access the guest floors, and told the time and location for the complementary hot breakfast. I'd noticed that one of the ladies at the desk had helped a group of people who checked just before us by providing a map and marking places on it that corresponded to the group's interests for dining and attractions. I asked the lady if she would do that for us and she kindly obliged. This was our first time to N.O. and that map was a tremendous help in finding the restaurants and hotel again. The bell man was going to store our luggage until our room was ready and we returned from lunch, but the room became available before we left the lobby so hubby and I took the luggage up to the room. Cool! Since the rest of our party wasn't in yet, hubby and I went off to eat lunch and see what was around. There is a street car that runs in front of the hotel, a short distance is Canal Street where more street cars make stops, CVS and Walgreens drug stores can be seen from the corner of Carondelet and Canal Streets, an Arby's fast food is close by (we stopped here for iced tea, which was delicious and refreshing as the day was a real scorcher), some other shops, close to good dining (we ate lunch at Deanie's Seafood - excellent), just across Canal Street Carondelet becomes Bourbon Street, and very close to the French Quarter attractions. The room was well-appointed. It had a brand new flat screen television, a lap writing desk, a desk, plenty of lamps, a mini refrigerator, safe, (if I remember correctly) a microwave, a bench at the end of the bed, and an chair. There was a window in the room with the view being a white brick wall. Oh well, we didn't mind. We were happy that we had a window at all (while researching hotels for this stay, we had read that some hotels have some rooms that don't have windows) and that the white of the wall reflected the outdoor light so the room seemed brighter. The sitting and sleeping were tidy and clean. The bathroom could have used a little bit more cleaning of the commode, but I took care of it with my standard traveling supplies (disinfecting wipes & spray). Ugh! It seems most hotel, cruise ship, and public bathrooms I get need extra cleaning these days :( . I asked my traveling companions about their bathroom cleanliness and they said their 3 bathrooms were totally clean. Yep, it's just me (rolling eyes). One member of our group (my aunt) had a problem with a passport that got left behind back home. The ladies at the front desk were instrumental in coming up with a solution because the big package services (Fed Ex and UPS) weren't open on Sunday. They literally saved the woman's vacation because without the passport, there was no way she could have gotten on the cruise ship the next day. Between the ladies at the desk, relatives in the hotel, the relative of one of our group back where the passport was left, a cargo service, the planes/airports, a taxi, my husband and the aunt, and maybe others I'm not aware of, the passport was able to be moved from point A to point B between late Saturday afternoon to early Sunday afternoon! Whew! Outstanding! "THANK YOU!" to all involved!!! Saturday night we slept very well. The bed and bedding were extremely comfortable, some of the best we've ever slept on/with. Cool! Sunday morning we went to the room with the hot breakfast buffet. The room was clean, large, had ample seating, and had a pleasant atmosphere. There was a good variety of hot and cold food and beverages (which were very good). The attendant kept things clean and replenished. Hubby, I, my brother, and his wife agreed it was the best complementary breakfast we've ever had in a hotel. Well done! Check out was quick and easy. From when we checked in, we knew the hotel had luggage storage service, so we asked to have our bags stored so we could explore the French Quarter and pick up some last minute items before heading to the cruise ship terminal. The ladies at the desk were still friendly and helpful, as was the bell man who tagged and stored our bags. Had no trouble retrieving Not exactly sure how it came about, but we ended up with a couple of vans to carry us all to the port. For a one night stay, a lot sure took place. Thanks to the great staff and very nice hotel property, we had a pleasant stay at the Hampton Inn Downtown/French Quarter. Hubby and I would very happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “HUGE rooms & Great Location but Average Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: MsTab
Reviews.Content: After staying in over five different Hampton Inns in Georgia, Florida and now Louisiana, I've come to the conclusion that Hampton Inn provides average customer service regardless of the location. When I checked in on Friday, July 22, 2011, Rosanna felt overwhelmed and didn't smile. I felt that I was inconveniencing her by checking in. That's the vibe I received from her. About my stay: My family visited New Orleans for a family reunion this past weekend and we stayed here. I must say the rooms are HUGE with a really nice flat screen TV. The bathroom needs some remodeling though.The refrigerator and microwave came in handy for our leftovers. The free breakfast was really good. I had a waffle and fruit, which was more than enough. Muffins, bagels, eggs, etc were also choices for breakfast. Also my little cousin brought her laptop and the free internet worked really well when I used her computer Valet Parking: I had to circle the block about three times because there wasn't any place to park in front of the hotel.Unfortunately, valet services were not moving the cars out fast enough. Valet parking was a big negative but when I saw my room, I forgot all about it. Since I'm really big on customer service, I will not stay at this Hampton Inn or any other Hampton Inn. If customer service isn't important to you, this Hampton Inn would be a perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location as long as you are not driving”
Reviews.Author: Irving-TX
Reviews.Content: Good location and nice safe hotel and rooms. In room safe was nice. Lots of space. Hot breakfast was fair with waffles and eggs. Wifi was consistently very slow. My main complaint was that there is no possible self parking option and the valet parking added $26 a day to your bill. We felt ambushed by this mandatory charge and cut our stay short. Maybe the other hotels do the same thing but we will not be returning to this hotel again when we drive to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Stay”
Reviews.Author: CrimsonDIVA6
Reviews.Content: I was traveling to New Orleans for a conference for my Sorority. I wanted to stay close to the convention center. I roomed with 3 others and we had an amazing time. The hotel was clean, quiet, and very accommodating. The room was spacious and had modern linen. The valet service was expensive. The staff was friendly. The free breakfast was an added bonus. If you are looking for a place that is near Bourbon but not too close, this hotel is perfect. We walked to Bourbon with ease. The only down fall was the gym it was not up to-date. The machine were outdated. Overall, I thoroughly enjoyed my stay. I've never written a review and felt that my experience at the hotel was worthy of sharing with others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Could Use Some Improvements”
Reviews.Author: shoe_gal25
Reviews.Content: My husband, 14 month-old son, and I stayed here June 19-25 for a convention/vacation. First, the pros. The hotel has valet service, bellman, comfy beds, micro/fridge, extensive breakfast, and cookies! The location is great for walking to the French Quarter and the staff were all very nice. We had a king study, which are corner rooms, and they are MUCH larger than the kind standards. Now, the cons. We decided to stay over an extra night, but our same room we had been in all week was unavailable that night due to a wedding group arriving for the weekend. We had to load up and move to a different floor, to a king standard, which was tiny and faced a white brick wall. That was not the hotel's fault though, since we waited until the last day to decide to stay over. We paid $109/night all week for the large room, but were told the rate in the smaller room would be $199/night. However, I asked for the Triple AAA discount and they discounted our room to $139. In the 1st room, on our TV remote, if we used the channel up/down buttons, the channels would not go past like channel 23 or 24. After channel 24, it would go back to channel 2. If you wanted to go past 24, you had to manually punch in each channel number. We tried reprogramming the TV channels with no luck. We didn't report it to the hotel, so no big deal. In the 2nd (smaller) room, you had to jiggle the toilet handle to stop the water from running after flushing. Also, in the king standard, there was no tub, just a stand up shower, so we had to bathe our baby in the shower and he screamed the whole time. Also, the floors and the bottom of the tub and showers looked dirty/dingy. The bathrooms need updating. The only complaint I have with breakfast is that they really need to leave the can of cooking spray next to the waffle iron for guests to spray the iron before making each waffle. The breakfast hosts would come out once in a while and spray the iron but then would take the spray back to the kitchen. The 1st waffle made after the spray was fine, but after that, anytime someone would make a waffle, it would stick and they would have to peel it off the iron (myself included). Overall, it was a good experience. The problems we did encounter were not dealbreakers, since we are not very fussy travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but need some renovations”
Reviews.Author: Sweetie0368
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Downtown/French Quarter frome 20-23 June. I was able to check in as soon as I arrived, even though it was before check-in time. The 2 clerks were very friendly and professional. I'm sorry I forgot one of the clerk's name, but Brandon was the other one. Loved them both!! I got to my room and it was the room that a previous reviewer had talked about. The windows were facing a brick wall so therefore there was no natural light coming in the room. I had to turn on every lamp to light up the room. I didn't like it, but I endured it. The room itself was spacious, clean, and it had a mini fridge, and a microwave which came in handy when bringing food and drinks back to the room. The bed was very comfortable! The bathroom was also spacious, but is in need of a major renovation. The next morning I went to breakfast and was satisfied with the items offered. I also used the fitness facility and I was quite pleased with the equipment that was available for use. They have one computer and it is located in the breakfast room. I used it twice and I only had to wait to use it once and I waited maybe 10 min. Anytime I needed information or directions, the front desk staff always gave me everything I needed. The only problem I had with housekeeping is that on the 3rd morning I was there, I had to wait until around 5:30ish to get my room serviced. I actually only needed fresh towels. I'm not the type that has to have my room vaccumed or the bed made everyday, but I do require fresh towels so that was a bummer. The toilet handle broke, so I called the front desk and not long after I hung up the phone, the maintainence man was there to fix the handle. That was great! The hotel is just a couple of blocks from the French Quarter. Carondelet Street actually turns into Bourbon St. when you cross Canal St. I think the location is perfect, because you are in walking distance to the French Quarter, Canal Street, the Riverwalk and Harrah's Casino, but yet far enough away from the hustle and bustle and noise. The street car stop is just steps away from the entrance of the hotel so that's a plus! Upon checking out I noticed that I was charged for 2 days of valet parking. I don't know where that came from considering I didn't even have a vehicle. I brought it to the front desk clerk, and he removed it from my bill. Overall I would say that the Hampton Inn is worth staying at when visiting New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location. Outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: Mictlan2468
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel during a conference. It is very conveniently located. Close enough to the French quarter, yet far away enough to keep the noise down. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The front door staff provided me with great dinning recommendations. I will be staying here again, and highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel; Excellent Location!”
Reviews.Author: TwoOnTheRun
Reviews.Content: Last year I switched hotels and stayed for a week at the Hampton Inn after one horrible nightâ€™s stay at the Holiday Inn Express (now the Cotton Exchange Hotel) across the street. I enjoyed the Hampton Inn so much last year that I decided to stay again for another week when I was in NOLA this past March. The hotel is conveniently located on Carondelet Street, just a few blocks from the French Quarter. Carondelet Street turns into Bourbon Street about three city blocks down from the hotel once you cross over Canal Street. The trolley line runs right in front of the hotel, so catching a ride is very easy. From the hotel itâ€™s an easy walk to most of the cityâ€™s popular restaurants and attractions. On both stays, I found the staff to be super friendly and very accommodating. Perhaps itâ€™s because of my Hilton Honors status, but on both visits, I was given a very large suite with nice views in either direction. On each stay, my room was huge; high ceilings, enormous windows and lotâ€™s of charm (a nice break from the cookie cutter chain hotel look). In both incidences I found my room to be very clean; beds and pillows extremely comfortable. As I stayed for an entire week both times, it was nice to have a refrigerator and microwave in the room. The hotel provides little perks that makes the stay a little more enjoyable; news paper waiting outside the door every morning, freshly baked cookies at the reception desk each evening and a â€œcomplementaryâ€� breakfast every morning. Mind you, itâ€™s typical Hampton Inn fare, but still good enough to start the day. The hotel also hosts a Managerâ€™s Reception every Wednesday evening; complementary beer, wine, appetizers and desserts; you could make a meal out of what they serve, but with all the great restaurants in the city, why would you want to? The front desk staff was great. They provided directions when I needed them, my wakeup call was always right on time and when I needed a taxi they had one ready and waiting for me. My only complaint was that on my last stay, after being out of my room for the entire day, when I returned around 6:00 pm I found that my room had not been cleaned. However, all it took was one call to the front desk and within half an hour my room was made up from top to bottom. All in all my stays at this hotel were both extremely positive. Iâ€™ll definitely stay at the Hampton Inn the next time Iâ€™m in the Crescent City!

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel of our holiday”
Reviews.Author: AUTISMSMITH
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights on a 12 day road trip and this was the worst! We were on the 12th floor with a view of a white brick wall!! We booked a kingsize room for us and our teenage son - when we got in the room there was no bed for him - they charged us ANOTHER $30 for a rollaway bed which barely fitted in the tiny room. The room was old and dirty and badly needed upgrading - and if they want to continue charging these prices they really should do that. I would NEVER stay here again or recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OLD OLD OLD”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: Did I mention how old and outdated this property is? I have stayed in several different hotels in New Orleans and realize that most properties are quite old in this city, but this Hampton Inn was the worst. Let me start with the positives. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. The location is great and is less than 2 blocks from Canal and Burbon Street. The bed was comfortable, internet was complimentary, and the channel selection on tv was better than most hotels. There was also a refrigerator and microwave in my room which was nice. Now the problems.....The owners should really invest some money in this property and renovate the rooms. I'm almost suprised that Hilton allows them to carry the Hampton name. The rooms are big with very tall ceilings, but this also makes the room feel empty and cold. The whole property has a certain smell to it, almost as if you were visiting a nursing home. I think my room has the original carpeting and couch from the 1870s and I almost felt like wearing sandals in my shower because the tub basin just looked gross. I've never seen such dirty windows in my lifetime and my room also had peeling paint and cracked calking. I was here for an entire week which also included Jazz Fest weekend. The weekend rate shot up to $249 per night which is absolutely ridiculous! If a hotel is going to charge $249 per night I am going to expect some phenominal service and facilities. I only hope the owners take a portion of that inflated rate and make some much needed renovations. As a Hilton Diamond member I was quite dissapointed and will not return next time I am in town.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and decent room size but house cleaning was HORRIBLE!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MDBud
Reviews.Content: Only a few blocks from boubon and a short walk to the casino. The rooms were decent size but dated, especially the bathroom. The bell staff was very friendly, helpful and grateful. The house cleaning at this hotel was so horrific that I would say it offsets the location benefit unless you make sure to note it at check in. We were there for 4 days just before and including Easter weekend and outside of the minuture trash can being dumped and the bed made (sheets were not even changed one day) very little was done. We had several empty coffee cups on a table and crumbs from a chips bag that were literally left there twice. The trash can was so small that we had to leave the newspaper and empty water bottle on the floor next to the can and they were left as well. The tub had some dripped shampoo on the rear of the tub that stayed the duration as well. It made me wonder what I should touch. It was a real shame the cleaning was so horrible because the location is close enough to being convenient and far enough away to get away from the excitement.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyFamily6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property for 3 nights and were pleased with almost everything. Location is good - a few blocks from all the French Quarter has to offer but far enough away to avoid all of the noise. We walked everywhere and never felt unsafe. There were a few pan handlers here and there, but they were harmless. The hotel is in a charming historic old building, The rooms were nice and big enough for us. Our view was of a roof and a wall, but we spent most of our time out and about, so it didn't matter. The breakfast was nice and there was a manager's reception one evening which inluded appetizers and beverages. The manager was very nice, helpful and attentive. We had a problem with our shower head and he had it repaired promptly. We arrived way before check in time on our first day and he got us in right away which was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Price, Great Location, Adequate Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Robinest01
Reviews.Content: Ok, so the price didn't really matter to me because the company was paying. But I know what they paid. It's your normal, everyday, run of the mill hotel. For the most part, clean & friendly. They have a free hot breakfast every morning, but I would stick to the continental items. Powdered eggs? Really? I didn't think they made such a thing anymore. Carondelet turns into Bourbon Street in a block and a half, which is great. Walking distance to most of the good restaurants and the casino. All in all - a good place to stay in New Orleans. If I were here on a vacation, I would probably be staying somewhere a little nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, okay hotel”
Reviews.Author: TravelGuy400
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights. Great location to the French Quarter. Far enough away not to be noisy, but close enough to walk there quick. Typical Hampton breakfast. You can walk anywhere to also get food. I parked my car on day 1 and didn't touch it until day 4. Rooms are dated, especially the bathroom. The first room I was given smelled badly of smoke trying to be covered up by an air freshener. Changed rooms with no hassle. The second room smelled much better, but you can still tell used to be a smoking room. Internet was slow at best. I would stay again just for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location & rooms but a few kinks”
Reviews.Author: TripTrip83
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge and the building is classic and has a lot of charm. The price also includes microwaves, refrigerators, wifi, and a huge spread for breakfast in the morning - eggs, meat, biscuits, waffle makers, fruit, cereals, breads, etc. The location is awesome too - 2 blocks from Bourbon St. without being in the middle of the craziness! I did have some trouble with the staff. My luggage was lost and I didn't get to the hotel until 11pm - without luggage. The sign in the room says to come to the front desk for a replacement of any toiletries you forgot. So, I went to the desk for some basic necessities. The guy actually laughed at me and said "why would we have those? There is a CVS down the block." Ummmm, ok, thanks, you have a sign that indicates otherwise... The next morning I needed to make a business call and my cell phone only had 2 bars of reception. I called the front desk to ask about the long distance rates. The response I received (after trying to call twice) was "I have no idea." On the last day, I called down to see if I could extend my check out - I called SIX times before someone picked up. Also, no one told me I needed a key to get into the front door after 11pm (or where to insert it) so I stood there bewildered one night until I found the hidden slot to put my key in.... Anyway, the hotel itself is great and I would definitely go back, especially since I rarely need the hotel staff, this time was an exception. Also, I think they are short/poorly staffed because when I was waiting for a taxi, there were at least 6 people around me in the waiting area filling out job applications... So, bottom line, it's a great place if you're self-sufficient!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Smidgen21
Reviews.Content: I stayed five nights at the Hampton Inn Downtown/FQ. The St. Charles Streetcar stops just a block away from the hotel. Less than 3 blocks from the corner of Canal St and Bourbon St. Fabulous shopping down Royal Street also just a few blocks away. The staff are incredibly responsive and helpful. I arrived very late at night, when I called the Front Desk to ask for recommendations for delivery, they offered to run up a variety of menus. I had them in my hand in less than 2 minutes. Breakfast was excellent (for hotel fare). Hot eggs and a meat choice each day. Fresh fruit and lots of baked goods to choose from. Bring your walking shoes! Many of sites within walking distance (less than 1 mile)....WWII museum, Aquarium, Riverwalk, Jackson Square, St. Louis Cathedral, Canal Street Ferry, The French Market (don't miss the Beignets and cafe au lait!!! at Dafe Du Monde). I started my visit with a city/cemetary tour from Cajun Encounters. The driver was extremely well versed in the history of the city and the tour gave me a sense of what I wanted to see during the rest of my time in the city. The tour lasted almost 3 hours. Look for a coupon to save $6/person in the official New Orleans tour book (free all over town).

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the city!”
Reviews.Author: Tiddapidda
Reviews.Content: Best location for French Quarter and Downtown. Hotel is very clean and the staff is great!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE...Couldn't Get the BASICS Right.”
Reviews.Author: FlyAwaaaay
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two horrendous nights during Mardi Gras weekend. The hotel was unable to: - Provide room keys that worked until the 5th time they were issued - Provide bathroom access when I couldn't get into my room - Provide the WIFI they claim to have - Get the cot we requested into our room until 7 hours after checkin and two reminders - Include a "Do Not Disturb" sign for the room - Locate the TV remote that was supposed to be in our room - Respond to ANY complaints without a sharp or nonchalant attitude from the front desk (except for Todd who was professional and helpful) On the other hand...the hotel is - In an ideal location, 1.5 blocks from Bourbon in the French Quarter - Has comfortable beds - Is clean (especially if the maid bothers to come) - Is reasonably priced I would stay here again if absolutely no other options were available, but there are too many friendly, organized B&B's and nice hotels in the area for this to happen.

Reviews.Title: “Solid value, clean...good choice”
Reviews.Author: SMcBaker
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here in a king/whirlpool room. It was a corner room and based the fire escape floorplan that was on the back of the door, it looked like all 4 of the corner rooms on our floor were larger than the interior rooms. The room was large, with a couch and sitting area, which included a microwave and fridge. Plenty of room to move around. The bathroom was large but, as others have mentioned, a little dated. Everything was very clean. The staff was so accommodating, even sending up bottled water and some chocolate within 10 minutes of our arrival. The A/C seemed a little sluggish and the maintenance guy was there 5 minutes after we let the water/candy person about it....then the front desk called after he was done to make sure that everything was ok! Breakfast was great. Standard Hampton Inn fare but well-run, nothing empty, plenty of seating in a nice, open room on the 4th floor. The valets were helpful and everyone was friendly. The location was good, just a short walk to the FQ yet the hotel was still quiet and away from all the activity. We did not have a car and found it easy to get around from the hotel. If you are looking for opulence, this is not your place...but if you are looking for good value for the $$, I don't think you'll be disappointed. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for family in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: TXvickster
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn Downtown/FQ. What a perfect place for a family! The rooms are large, & have tall ceilings, 2 VERY comfy queens, sleeper sofa, frig, & microwave. You can even do a rollaway for $15. I booked it through Travelocity for $125/night - a fabulous bargain. There is a very nice breakfast included - fresh fruit, the usual, plus decent omelettes, bisquits & gravy. Location is perfect too - on Carondelet which turns into Bourbon street one block over at Canal St. You are away from the craziness, but close enough to get there in 1 minute. HINT: The back entrance is the one to come and go out of - much nicer to walk to FQ. That street is St. Charles, but turns into Royal once you cross Canal St. We never got our car out of the garage. Just a delightful, clean, safe place to stay. All staff was extremely helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: rk_carlton
Reviews.Content: Best part about this hotel is the location. Just a block away from the beginning of Bourbon and Canal. Short walk to all the shops on Decatur and the Riverwalk area. The hotel entrance and room was very clean. Workers are very nice. The room was spacious but I did wish the bathrooms were a little more updated. If you are looking for an ultra modern hotel this wouldnâ€™t be the place for you. The free breakfast was nice. We ate there one morning and it consisted of waffles, premade omelets, biscuits, gravy, asst. pastries, cereals, coffee and juice bar, fruits. I might try to find a â€œnewerâ€� hotel in the area next time we visit NOLA but I would defiantly come back to the Hampton at a later visit. Tip! Get up early and visit Daisy Dukes just up the block from the hotel. They have an early bird breakfast for $3.99 thatâ€™s delish!!!

Reviews.Title: “Close to Everything, but Quiet Enough to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: PittTrvlr
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Hampton Inn overall. I chose this hotel because of the excellent reviews on TripAdvisor and the great rate I found and it's location close to the FQ and Canal Street. The service was friendly and effective, the breakfast was standard Hampton fare, but with plenty of tables and room for lots of people, and the room was clean and large for an inner-city hotel. We were high enough up that the room was quiet and the bed very comfortable. Either because of all the food and drink or because of the bed itself, we slept very well the whole trip. The location was very convenient for walking to the Quarter (2 blocks from Bourbon St) and Riverwalk/Aquarium/Casino areas. However, the block of Carondelet between the hotel and Canal St. is rather shady and smelly (they didn't clear the piled-up garbage for 3 days) with lots of empty storefronts and not great lighting. I didn't feel extremely unsafe, but I wish this block were cleaned up...the rest of the walk to the Quarter and other venues was perfectly fine. Also, the bathroom could use updating, more shelving/storage (especially in the shower), and the view is not great (other buildings across, a rooftop with heating units below). Overall, great value, convenient hotel and clean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: tafo
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. The hotel is in walking distance to everthing. Carondelet is Bourbon St. once you cross over Canal St. Hotel is clean, great employees, easy check in. There were 3 of us in the room and the hotel had no problem with splitting the bill and putting the charge on 3 different cards. Breakfast is a good spread. It runs from 6 - 10 and has a great selection of foods. From make your own waffles, biscuits, eggs, bagels, to yogurt, fruits, cereals, etc. After breakfast, tea, coffee and fruits are available all day. Cookies are available at the front desk. Lots of tables are available for breakfas. The is a little time allowance before the breakfast is cleared away. Some place I have visited cleans up on the dot. Room: We got a large room with 2 bed and a pullout coach. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Room was missing the luggage rack, but after a call to the front desk, one was delivered within 5 mins. Wireless internet is available everywhere. There is a computer and printer available on the 4th floor - the breakfast room also. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: BeachLadee
Reviews.Content: Before staying at the Hampton I stayed at a different hotel nearby. We left that hotel as late as could and arrived at the Hampton before check-in. Luckily, they were able to find a room for my fiance and me. We were settling in when a man came with a water and some candies. I still have no idea why he brought them to us, but I very much enjoyed them! The rooms, which included a mini fridge and microwave, had tall ceilings and were spacious. The one negative was the bathroom which was in serious need of a remodel. The location was perfect- two blocks from the French Quarter, but in the much quieter CBD. The breakfast was on the 4th floor was very good. It included your basics as well as a few hot items. The hotel was attached to a food court and some shops. The front desk was on the street level, but it seemed like the hotel started on the 4th floor (you have to use your card to access these levels). Overall I was pleased with the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Near French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: LiangShanBo
