Reviews.Content: Hotel is about a block and a half from the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. Rooms are clean and nice. Bathrooms could use some updating though. Unlike Hampton Inns in suburbia near highway exits, this one is a well-maintained older building.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great location”
Reviews.Author: Balmad
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because of its location. I was also looking not to spend to much and it was the cheapest in the area. The room was huge and although it was the typical room of a hotel chain it was sort of cozy, everything was clean. We asked for an extra bed and there was plenty of space for it. Only disadvantages: a wired smell could be noticeable sometimes and the views were ugly, but for the price, we couldnÂ´t ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, Fantastic City”
Reviews.Author: SG1974
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights In December 2010. The hotel is located just a couple of blocks from Canal Street. We stayed in a 2 double bed room on the 12th floor. There were several lifts which were quick and also required your door key to operate. We had good nights sleep and did not hear any street noise whatsoever. This was one of the main reasons why we chose to stay outside the French Quarter. The room was very spacious it included flat screen TV, room safe, in room free wifi, A/C unit. The bathroom was fine, but a bit dated. The breakfast which is included in your room rate was better than expected. It included cereals, eggs, bacon, bread, bagels etc. It was constantly replenished whilst we were there. We walked everywhere from the hotel, the French quarter is just on the other side of canal street, The world war 2 & ogden museum are only about 10 - 15 minutes, and the aquarium is also close. We had a great time in New Orleans the New Years eve fireworks were good. The city was even better than we expected, we only have fond memories and would love to go back at some stage in the future. Not only does the city have some outstanding sights to see but the food is also very good. It was great to sample gumbos, po boys, beignets (from cafe du monde), praline etc. We had our best dining experience of our trip in MiLa which is located very close to the hotel. A visit to New Orleans is essential!

Reviews.Title: “Great Find”
Reviews.Author: Insalata17
Reviews.Content: We went as a family - parents and 21-yr old son - to New Orleans just after Christmas to immerse ourselves in good music, food, art, architecture, and culture. We chose the Hampton Inn Downtown/French Quarter because the price was right and the location seemed conducive to walking most everywhere. Indeed, it met our expectations and went beyond them - the room was large, well-appointed; the front desk bent over backwards to help with anything we requested; breakfasts were typical Hampton Inn food but adequate to keep us going for several hours; the location was great for long but good walks into the French Quarter and Bourbon Street, the Warehouse District, and other places downtown; and a trolley as well as a busline were easily accessible. We had no problem walking to and fro from here up through midnight. Indeed, we shall return!

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate to book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: soloonthego
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during the OSU Sugar Bowl win over Arkansas! Check in/out was a breeze..Great location for the money, in the heart of everything..1 blk from Canal St., just steps from Bourbon St, couple blocks away from Harrah's Casino..Walked to the game at the Superdome! Room was clean, maid service was excellent..lots of good restaurants in the area, including Brothers Grocery on the corner which was open 24hrs! Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: TravelingMomma73
Reviews.Content: I have visited New Orleans several times and this was my first time staying at the Hampton Inn. I picked this hotel based on location, price and free breakfast. So here are some of the ups and downs of my stay: Ups: Hotel info said the trolley stop was in front of the hotel. Well this is partitially true if you walk out through the back doors facing St. Charles Ave. You can catch the St. Charles trolley here but I recommend that you walk out the front and walk the 1 block to Canal and catch the St Charles Ave trolley here as it is the beginning point and is the best place to get on and be able to get a seat. The Canal St trolley line is directly across the street from the St Charles trolley stop so this was good. Check-in and check-out was a breeze. No problems with friendly staff at desk. We got a corner room that didn't have the best view but that was ok given the amount of floor space we gained. Plenty of room and nice sized beds. The hotel also offers a free breakfast and it is not your usual danish buffett. There was a make-your-own waffle station, eggs, biscuits, assortment of breakfast breads and cereals, fresh fruit, coffee and juice. This was a true bargin for those traveling with kids. Tiffany kept it stocked and tidy. They do have an afternoon feeding but we never went to it. But it looked like more than chips and salsa were served. Another plus is the food court located in the building. The Carondelete St side had the hotel and the St Charles Ave side was a business complex. On the 2nd floor is a food court offering many different types of cuisine. This is great for grabbing a quick lunch if you're not out and about and just want to stay in. Now for the downs: There are only 2 downs for me. The first one was the mattress on the bed. Talk about firm! It was stiff as a board. I know some people like this but it was truly uncomfortable. The other down, and the major one, was the bathroom. All I can say is yuck! Compared to other Hamptons I've stayed in, this bathroom looked like it belonged in a motel and not a hotel. It was small and very yucky looking. There were stains on the floor that I don't think would come out. The tub had cracks all around it and the water pressure sucked. I think they cleaned it but it was very hard to tell. This was a major issue for me but one I had to let slide for the week. Overall, the price was right and I would have to think hard about staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located and perfect for our stay.”
Reviews.Author: tamurray
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over our Christmas trip and found the location perfect. It's two blocks to the French Quarter and the streetcars, a few minute walk to the river, 15 minute walk to the WWII museum. The room was a corner room and it was good sized for my teens and I. I was surprised by the size of the room really. Breakfast room is on 4th floor and well done. Staff were always available to refill something or answer a question. We were spoiled by the waffles each morning :) One disappointment to me was the lack of a breakfast meat as I was used to that from other Hamptons. Overall, it was a great addition to the trip however. The computer and printer is located here as well. The bed was not what I was used to for a Hampton. It was much firmer than others. Room was cleaned each day and ready for our return. The staff at the desk were helpful. Someone else mentioned Ryan - he was a great help on the phone and in person. We had a housekeeping and maintenance issue during our stay and both were attended to very quickly. There is no restaurant associated with the hotel but several are on the street outside and they deliver. Our room was on the back/side of the hotel and gave us a view of the bridge off in the distance and the quarter. There are other high rise buildings around and their windows do look on to yours and you to them. We did a a view of the air chiller/exchanger but it did not impact the sound in our room as someone else mentioned. Elevator service was efficient both to and from the 12th floor. Trash cans in the room were a bit small. Overall, I was pleased with my stay at this Hampton Inn. It was convenient, reasonably price and comfortable. The room was clean, the hotel reasonable and staff helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn Downtown New Orleans- Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Pachugita
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great location. It is located in a office building. Plenty of business travelers during the week. You must use your room key to operate the elevator. This was our first time staying at a Hampton Inn and we loved it. The room was large; there was a refrigerator and microwave. The hotel is a worn and could use some updating. Breakfast was plentiful and great. There were two young women who kept the breakfast buffet well supplied and clean. They worked really hard. I don't know about valet service because we did not rent a car. We used the streetcars and walked. This hotel is in a great location to get around to everything. We traveled with our 5 year old and he loved New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Super Friendly Desk Staff!”
Reviews.Author: lmcdaniel
Reviews.Content: We were in New Orleans for my brother's wedding and made reservations here. It is sooo close to everything. We were able to walk to Bourbon easily as well as the French Market / Jackson Square area. The rooms were cleaned in a timely manner and the establishment was well kept. The girl at the front desk on Thursday 10/14 in the evening was fantastic, super friendly and made us feel right at home. I liked the fact that you had to have a key to operate the elevator, it made us feel safer. One negative is the $30 charge for valet. There are cheaper lots within a block from this location that cost $15-$20, so if you have a car I would reccomend that. Overall we would definitely stay here in the future and reccomend!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased with our stay”
Reviews.Author: ssandjc
Reviews.Content: We did a stay and park rate at the hotel which was very reasonable. The hotel room was very large and nice with a desk and lounging chair. We had a shower and no tub in our room but that was just fine with us. The hotel is connected with a business office building that has a convenience store in it too. The breakfast was good with a lot of selection that you'd find at other Hampton Inns. I liked the location of the hotel as it was close enough to everything. Getting the car from the valet was quick and easy - really great service and everyone was very nice. I would definitely stay here again when in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kezz38
Reviews.Content: This was a good choice of hotel in NOLA, great location very close to the French Quarter, less than a five minute walk. The rooms are clean and a good size. Check in was quick and easy and the manager on duty (I think it was Jeffrey) was extremely helpful and welcoming. The advantage of being just outside the FQ is that the hotel is lovely and quiet and you can get a good nights sleep!! An additional bonus is you get free wi-fi!!Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worked well for business trip”
Reviews.Author: hbhakh
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn while attending a meeting in New Orleans. It had received positive reviews, which swayed my decision. I was not disappointed. The location is two block away from Bourbon Street on the other side of Canal Street, making it convenient and pretty quiet. Check in was prompt and I received a large room, with a separate sitting area. It had the normal Hampton amenities. The breakfast area was spacious and served the usual Hampton fare, including fresh waffles. My only complaint was that there is some wear and tear in the hallways and rooms but nothing that a little upgrading couldnâ€™t fix. This is a good choice for NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Sleeping there is impossible”
Reviews.Author: Londinium
Reviews.Content: At first sight, when we entered the room, we found it huge and quite comfortable. It was room 713, a corner room. There is a safe, a small fridge and a microwave. Then we realised that if we left the curtains open, everyone using the parking opposite the building could see into the room so we closed all the curtains and left for a walk. When we came back and went to bed, we heard a noise and in fact there are 2 huge things for the airco probably just opposite the window (see my photos). These stop only during the day and start again at night so we had this noise all night long, with some vibrations too, a real nightmare. On the second day, they started around 21H30. Then there is this small fire alarm in the room which also makes some noise from time to time. Not the best nights I have ever had so if you go to this hotel, ask to be away from this side of the building. The hotel offers free wifi but the connection is not stable so you have to reconnect several times and itâ€™s really slow. (connection lost +/- every 10 to 15 minutes) Housekeeping is cleaning the room so quickly that our bins where not emptied and there were still some crisps on the carpet near the beds. Otherwise the hotel is close to the French Quarter, there is a CVS on the corner where you can get something to eat and to drink. We took a cab from the airport to the hotel: 33 dollars for 2 persons and it took only 15 minutes so itâ€™s worth the price. Breakfast is really not good but I suppose that itâ€™s because Iâ€™m European â€¦ I prefer to have fresh croissants than having these pancakes that we usually eat for desserts in the afternoon instead of having them at breakfast. Thatâ€™s not the first Hampton Inn that I try, again Iâ€™m disappointed and really prefer the â€˜classicâ€™ Hilton hotels.

Reviews.Title: “A very good value hotel with a pretty good location”
Reviews.Author: Texas_Traveler71
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed several days at the Hampton Inn in New Orleans earlier this year. The hotel was great with nice rooms and a very good breakfast. The service at the hotel was excellent...especially the valet and bell service. They all made us feel at home. The hotel location is also pretty good. However, with our younger children, we found it not quite close enought to the French Quarter to walk. Therefore, we still drove most places. This is the only reason we might stay elsewhere next time. However, if your business will keep you more on the west side of the French Quarter or north of the convention center, this hotel would work very well.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Lady_2004
Reviews.Content: From the time we were greeted by the front desk, we were made to feel like a valued guest. We arrived at the hotel a bit early and had to check our bags. We requested a room on a high floor and got it. There were no negative remarks to our request or going in the back room to discuss. When we finally got to our room, it was clean and larger than I would have guessed for a Hampton.( front desk staff member called to see if everything was ok). The breakfast area is located in the 4th floor dining area as well a computer and large screen TV. The hotel also has free wi fi throughout the hotel. Breakfast is the typical Hampton Buffet Breakfast. There is a gym on this floor also but I did not use it. Parking is costly, we did not rent a car. We took a cab which is $33.00 flat rate to the city(plus tip). Cabs are plentiful in front of the hotel if you need a ride to the airport. I think there is a Shuttle for $20.00 per person from airport, since there were two of us, it was cheaper to use a cab. Hotel is located 2 blocks from Canal Street..cross it and you are at the beginning of the French Quarter. There is a CVS on the corner to pick up odds and ends. On week days the hotel opens up to an office building with shops and fast food places to eat on the second level.. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: TinyFish
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a great stay at the Hampton Inn Downtown New Orleans. The location was great - very close to Bourbon street, but without all the noise and craziness. The manager's reception on Wednesday's was beyond all expectations - nice spread for appetizers and drinks. Would highly recommended and plan to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, above par service for Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: 16weekayeartraveler
Reviews.Content: This is my second visit to this Hampton Inn, The first was on business, this one with my wife. The down side is the expensive valet fee, but when you consider where you are and what the lot's charge it is not bad, just a bit pricey. I was able to book a stay and park rate so this offset the price. The service is very good, from the doormen to the front desk. Being a historic building the layout has a nice vibe, the rooms are not cookie cutter, but rather charming. I would like to see housekeeping clean the carpets better, but that is the only thing I can point to as an issue. The location is great, very close to everything and the staff is great to point out things to do,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Support Staff - Front Desk Clerk ?? - Hotel A Bit Dated”
Reviews.Author: pcsanity
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this location for two nights while traveling for a wedding and weekend getaway. The location was easily found by our GPS and the hotel only a few minutes walk straight down the street from all the action of Bourbon St. But being across Canal we did not experience the crazy noise of Bourbon. (Turn right out of the hotel lobby and you are on the heart of Bourbon in 2/10 of a mile) The only parking associated with the hotel is valet service, but is about the same price as all other hotels in the area. The valet was always very prompt and courteous. (Though I found it odd the valet was not tall and always left our seat way too close for me to get into the car!) Check in was rather disorganized. The clerk could not find our name and then they had reassigned us from the pre selected room to a very poorly laid out room where the elevator lobby looked right into the room. After some persistence and argument with the clerk, and threatening to invoke the 100% Guarantee, we finally got a hold of the manager who moved us to a smaller but much better located room. Still not the service I expect as a HHonors Diamond member. There is a small but nicely decorated, inviting lobby with a small front desk. They have a large nicely appointed common area. (Breakfast area) on the 4th floor that is only accessible to guests but is open 24/7 with coffee, tea, and fruit. Fresh cookies were available each evening at the front desk. The hotel has a non-typical layout as it is a historic building. Each room is somewhat different it seems. The hotel does not have a pool, but that is not a problem given we were not expecting one. They have a small gym, but we did not have the opportunity to check it out. They do not really have a business center but have one computer and printer in the breakfast area. The hotel has free internet access for guests in the common areas and rooms. We found it to be of acceptable speed. The rooms are typically decorated, and comfortable but a in need of updating, but were clean. The beds are acceptable. They have large but old style CRT TV's with sufficient channels. The climate control works and you can leave the blower motor on for white noise while the climate control is still functioning. The room had no discernable noise from nearby rooms. Even though our second room was on the 5th floor, the second set of windows on the room kept out the majority of the noise, but as with any city hotel, you could hear some traffic. I imagine higher rooms have less noise. Room included a work desk (though you could not see the TV from the desk), microwave, fridge, and chair / ottoman. Some rooms have fold out couches. Bathrooms are well equipped with plenty of storage and counter space, but rather dated. Some rooms have a tub / shower combo and others have a shower only. The blow dryer in the room was a bit of a pain since you had to hold a spring loaded handle to keep it in the on position. The first blow dryer broke, but maintenance quickly brought up a temporary one and then replaced the built in one that day. Of course this location lends itself to quick and easy access to the street cars, Bourbon Street, the French Quarter, and even Jackson Square. The night time walk from the heart of Bourbon to the hotel was well populated and felt safe. (Of course always watch out in any big city!) The breakfast area appeared to have plenty of seating in the morning, but we never had the breakfast....decided to eat out one day and slept in too late the other. The day we looked in they had typical Hampton breakfast, scrambled eggs with cheese, biscuits, sausage gravy, waffle maker, pastries, cereal, juices, coffee, etc. They did not have the "on the run bags: with an apple, muffin, cereal bar, water, and mints as it was the weekend, but I am sure they have those on the weekdays. The staff was cordial, though the one night desk clerk must have been new as he did not seem to have his act totally together. The real highlight of the staff was the bellman Bryan. He was absolutely great. Provided great late night dinner, breakfast, and lunch recommendations whenever we asked. He really seemed to enjoy his job and as lifetime local really liked to share tips about his hometown.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous experience.”
Reviews.Author: ShelbyLynn75
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn on Carondelet Street over Memorial Day weekend. We drove from St. Louis with our 8-year-old. The hotel was easy to find. Check in was a breeze taking only a few minutes. The valet helped us unload our bags and loaded them onto a cart for us, something that wasn't even done for us at several Hyatt hotels we've stayed at in various cities. Our room was very large. Two comfortable double beds, a couch, coffee table, desk with chair, a huge armoire housing the flat panel tv, in-room safe (which is great for laptops and other electronics), coffee maker, microwave, and mini-fridge. There were three enormous windows on one wall. The view was of another building, but that's what you get sometimes in a city. We were directly across from the ice machine, but we never heard it. The bathroom was huge. All three of us were in there at once brushing our teeth, and we could have easily fit a few more people in there. The shower head is fabulous! Great water pressure. We took the longest showers there. The climate control in the room was fantastic. We were able to turn the temp down low so we were greeted to a nice cool room after walking the French Quarter in 95 degree heat and humidity. The location is great. It is located a block and a half from Canal Street and Bourbon Street. We walked every where. The street car runs right in front of the building on Carondelet Street. We used our car once because we went to Metairie for a concert. We called down for our car 15 minutes before we planned to leave. We walked down 10 minutes later, and our car was waiting for us. When we returned late that night there was a valet available to park our car. The hotel is secure as you must use your room key card to open the front doors during late hours. The key card is also necessary to take the elevator to floors 4-14. The complimentary breakfast was fantastic for the $99/night we paid for the room. Fresh fruit, yogurt, cold cereal assortment, pastries, bagels, biscuits, sausage gravy, omelets, cajun potatoes, an array of juices, and coffee. The food was constantly replenished, none of this "get there before it's gone" business. The dining area is very large and accomodated the large number of guests eating quite easily. The housekeeping staff were very nice and courteous. They knocked each morning and asked if we needed our room serviced. Any staff we encountered in the hotel were extremely nice. The late night front desk clerk offered us several suggestions regarding where we could get a late night bite to eat. (Brother's chicken is practically next door. Great late night treat.) Upon departure, the valet retrieved our car quickly even though there several guests pulling in for check-in. He helped us load up our car. I would also like to point out that we booked our room through Expedia.com and were treated with respect and courtesy. I know sometimes using booking sites such as that have been the basis for some people not getting treated the same as other customers, but the Hampton Inn on Carondelet Street was not one of those establishments. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: deucedixon
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I wanted to take a quick trip for Memorial Day weekend so decided on NOLA. I booked The Hampton Inn because it was only $109 a night and we were watching our budget. We planned on drinking, eating and shopping alot so decided to cut back on the hotel. When I booked the room online, only smoking was avaliable so I said "whatever" and went ahead and reserved the room. We got checked in quickly and the staff was friendly. We got to the room and it did not smell like smoke at all. I was so happy because we do not smoke. We were so suprised at how big the room was. I was thinking it would be a shoe box. It was almost like a suite. We stayed in room 709 I beleive. The bed was really comfy and there was a mini fridge which was nice for our beer & such. The bathrooms were pretty clean but old tile lined the floor and a tad bit of mildew in the shower but not nasty. Several times our room keys quit working & the staff was always nice in getting us new ones. It was never loud in the hotel either. It is only 2 blocks to Canal and Bourbon Street. There is a corner store (24 hours I think)across the street from the hotel so we got drinks and snacks everyday. Keep in mind the hotel does not have room service or a restaurant....but theres always something open because New Orleans never sleeps. The hotel had these awesome Otis Spunkmeyer (spelling?) cookies at the front desk in little bags that were so fresh and good. We will stay here again if go back to NOLA anytime soon. The location is what we absolutly loved.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: lagirl33
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great staff. Had a problem with a leaky air conditioner and it was cleaned up within minutes. Nice location, a few blocks from Bourbon. Close enough to walk, but far enough to get peace and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Great one night stay before a cruise”
Reviews.Author: umtigerfan1
Reviews.Content: Just a quick one night stay before our cruise. The hotel is very convenient to all attractions and the service goes beyond most Hampton Inns. My only complaints would be the slow elevators and the large amount of mold in the shower. The free breakfast was very good and lots of room.

Reviews.Title: “Will go back”
Reviews.Author: rgants
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a couple times before this stay and every stay is great. Beds are comfortable and rooms are spacious. Also is close everything.

Reviews.Title: “awesome service”
Reviews.Author: simnix
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for just one night on may 7th. Check-in was surprisingly fast considering it was about 5pm and they only had one person checking people in. She was quite pleasant to deal with. we stayed in room 405. The room was incredibly large and had great view of Carondelet street. Bed was very comfy! wife liked the bathroom not to small water pressure and air conditioning worked fine! Breakfast area is quite big and great breakfast choices and best of all it's included with the hotel stay . definitely a plus if undecided between hotels. no pools though. location is not bad, few blocks from bourbon street. St-Charles street car stops right in front.Valet service was efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton's still got it, but with a glitch or two”
Reviews.Author: gazooby
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with spouse for extended weekend to cash in Hilton Honors points. Loved the hotel in almost every way. High points: charming and knowledgeable front desk staff and bellhops. Location right on St. Charles streetcar line, and within walking distance of many tourist hotspots. Room was large and well appointed, if a bit dusty (set off my allergies). Beds luxurious. Bathroom miniscule but we managed. Breakfast very nice, a notch up on hot buffets in a big room with plenty of comfortable seating. Only big complaint was the housecleaning crew, who held a family reunion outside our door one afternoon (seriously, mom and dad were there too) and literally woke us up from a nap. Then the next day, one of the crew actually threw away a bottle of my makeup that I'd left sitting on a counter. It looked empty but wasn't. I have never heard of a housecleaning staff doing this -- always thought they were instructed "if it's not yours, leave it alone." Overall, the stay was great, but a few minor notes.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: NemoTraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in the end of March and chose this hotel due to a fair rate and favorable reviews. The location is great. It is only a short walk to Bourbon Street and at the same time we enjoyed the quiet area. Public transportation is close - the St. Charles streetcar runs on Carondelet and the Canal Street streetcar is one block away. Our room was large and with a nice view of downtown. Internet connection in our room was excellent. Breakfast is complimentary and of good quality. The breakfast room is quite large with adequate seating. The Business Center (one computer with printer) is in the breakfast room. The hotel could do with an update, but in general we enjoyed staying here and would probably choose the same hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: Samtoh
Reviews.Content: We were in NOLA Easter weekend 2010 and we chose the Hampton Inn on Carondelet as our base. We stayed here for 2 nights and generally pleased with our choice of hotel. The room was spacious and the king bed comfy. We liked the fact that the room came with a microwave and a mini fridge. Internet was also complimentary. The only thing we didn't like was the bathroom. It was too small and it didn't have a bath tub. The bath amenities were also rather basic. The hotel offers a daily complimentary breakfast from 6am to 10am. We are not fussy eaters so we felt the food was adequate. A choice of breakfast cereals, sweet breads, a waffle station, fresh fruit, yogurt, a hot food station, fruit juice, tea and coffee. The breakfast room is spacious and comfortable -there's a big flat screent T.V. in the room and the hotel's only computer is located in there also. Note that tea and coffee are served all day long from the breakfast room. The hotel is in a safe location and less than a 5 minute walk to the French Quarter. There is a CVS store just around the corner on Carondelet and Canal so handy for snacks / drinks, and the St Charles Streetcar goes pass the front of the hotel also. Overall we were fairly happy with our stay. We would stay here again providing the room rates stay competative.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, good location, dated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: vagardener
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn French Quarter area for a week on vacation. The hotel is conveniently located just a block and a half from the French Quarter - very easy walking distance but on a quieter street. The service was outstanding. When we arrived, we walked into the room and discovered that the one window opened directly (as in just a couple feet) onto the side of another building, which made the room very dark and dreary. We called the front desk to ask for another room and were immediately offered a larger, very light room at the front of the building. The staff was very helpful. Unfortunately, it had two queens instead of a king. So beware if you want a king--we were told all of the standard king rooms have windows facing the side of the other building. The free wifi and included breakfast are nice perks and there's a free computer/printer in the breakfast room, which is very handy. One morning when it wasn't working the front desk manager even let us use her personal laptop to print a voucher we needed. And the manager called our room to make sure we were happy with our stay. On the downside, the rooms are quite dated--especially the bathrooms. Our guess was that the hotel hasn't been remodeled since it was converted to a Hampton Inn in the mid 90s. The rooms are just ok. But if you're looking for an affordable option near the French Quarter with great service, this is a good choice.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it here.”
Reviews.Author: Bridgette333
Reviews.Content: We loved our room. Shower good. Elevators good. Very pleased. Walking distance to all tourist sites but recommend taxi home at night. Complimentary Breakfast too rich -need more basic food.

Reviews.Title: “NCAA basketball visit”
Reviews.Author: JRTheChief
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights in this Hampton during the NCAA basketball tournament.The hotel is a couple of blocks off Canal Street and located on the St. Charles trolley line. The building was originally designed by famed architect Daniel Burnham. It was converted to a hotel in the early 90's. Rooms tend to be spacious. The staff was very friendly and efficient. The breakfast bar offered a couple of hot items not typically offered in other Hampton locations. The food is served on an island rather that up against the wall. This design made things a bit more efficient. The room was in good shape. The only signs of wear were some carpet in public spaces. Security is good. You must swipe your room card to access the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, nothing bad...nothing fancy”
Reviews.Author: Dcl1973
Reviews.Content: picked this hotel for its location for the NCAA Tourney games at the new orleans arena (15-20min walk) and Bourbon St ( 1 block) hotel didnt disapoint. buddy and I stayed 3 nights here. rooms are pretty basic. tv, fridge, microwave, coffeemaker, hairdryer..etc.....ceilings are very high and windows are equally as big making it a little tough to keep the room dark in the morning but its not a big deal at all. bathroom is a little dated but everything works just fine overall if i come back to new orleans and get a good deal here i will stay again and would tell friends to stay here if their travels take them here

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: ccce1823
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Close to Bourbon Street, and downtown. Great service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: edpaffjr
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel couldn't be much better. It is just a very short walk to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter Area. The rooms were a tad on the smaller side, but quite nice. My only real complaint on the room was the older dial thermostat. I've come to expect programmable thermostats in most hotel rooms. The complimentary breakfast was better than most Hampton Inn's and stayed available past the advertised closing time of 10. Our request for a late checkout was provided, and the staff all seemed very friendly. I would likely stay here again on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Value. Gotta Love Hampton”
Reviews.Author: RP2012
Reviews.Content: Had a great stay in a Hampton in Mexico City so Id thought Id try it in New Orleans. And they did not disappooint. Great Location near everything and great service. Clean, and good size rooms. When i go back it will be my first choice

Reviews.Title: “A solid business hotel”
Reviews.Author: moonsammy4
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a room with two colleagues. The room was adequate for the three of us (includeing a rollaway bed). The location was walking distance to the convention center and it was right on the border of the French Quarter. Breakfast was included and it was passable (biscuits were great though). My only beef was that there was only one computer for a very large hotel.

Reviews.Title: “clean, convenient, good value..ticks all the boxes”
Reviews.Author: hollydaze
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed a 4 night stay at Hampton Inn French Quarter during a recent conference trip. There were 3 of us staying in the room, so I was concerned about the size. I was pleasantly surprised that even with a rollaway bed and 3 bags, we still had lots of room! Loved the mini fridge and microwave (heated up our bourbon bread pudding real nice!)..housekeeping did an excellent job of cleaning the room, including having our rollaway prepped and ready for our late arrival on the first night. Extra towels for the 3 of us was a nice touch as well. The free breakfast was sufficent (great biscuits!) and the little coffee shop attached to the building (open on weekdays) did an amazing americano coffee (and had some nice treats as well). Service was friendly but not overly so...this is not 5 star kiss your butt service..but for the price, do you really expect that? Large, clean rooms, helpful staff, great location..what more can you ask for? I'd do a repeat visit if I ever landed in NOLA again (and I hope I do!)

Reviews.Title: “Halloween in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Reddon14
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at this hotel during my Halloween and Monday night football trip to NOLA. The hotel met my expectations and the location was great. It is only two blocks from the start of Bourbon street which has much to offer in the form of nightlife and restaurants. The price of the hotel was reasonable, as was the continental breakfast. Don't expect a full buffet spread, but they do have your typical pastries/bagels in addition to a couple of daily hot items (changes from sausages/eggs/french toast/etc). The rooms were very large in size however the carpets and bathrooms were starting to get a little worn. If you want a decent hotel, with decent prices and a great location, I recommend the Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Always a great stay at any Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Kimberkki
Reviews.Content: The location of the Hampton Inn is two blocks from Canal & Bourbon Street. Great location for walking to everything in the French Quarter, but quite at night. This Hampton Inn has all the comforts of a Hampton Inn, but it is in a historic building with a door/valet man. Everyone was so helpful for recommendations. Beautiful hotel that was a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, staff and condition”
Reviews.Author: JP1976
Reviews.Content: This was a great find. Very good rates. Great location. Hotel is actually an abandoned historic building. Rooms are huge with lots of tall windows. The staff was very good and friendly. The breakfast was excellent. Valet parking was pricey, >$25 per day. There is a public garage less than a block from the hotel so I would recommend using that instead. The hotel is located less than 3 blocks from Bourbon st and the French Quarter. Easily walkable. The Green line Street car passes right in front of the hotel. You can take this street car and connect to the canal street line or simply take it all the way up St. Charles st. Hotel had great wifi, water pressure, clean rooms with nice furniture, awesome bed and even a shopping center connected to the back entrance. I would definitely recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Price, pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: dialex
Reviews.Content: We travled from Dallas to go to a Saint's game. We loved the friendliness and cleanliness of the hotel. Great Valet staff. Breakfast could of used a meat of somekind, it was all bread and carbs. But very clean and the presentation was nice. We would definitely use this hotel again for future New Orleans visits.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: Essence2009
Reviews.Content: This hotel had an excellent location! It is within walking distance to the Convention Center and the Superdome. This hotel is only 3 blocks from Bourboun Street , but you don't get the loud noises and partying, very quite location The room was clean and spacious...the refrig and microwave came in handy as well. Finally, the entire staff was top notch, very customer driven. I would recommend this hotel for folks who want to be off the beaten path but still have access to all things New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: ptmom
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights June 8-11th. Had a basic King room-but the high ceilings made it seem very spacious, even had a view of the french quarter. Everything was very clean and room was always made up by noon. Breakfast was typical Hampton breakfast, but the fitness room was triple the regular sized Hampton rooms. Hotel was very quite, never heard others or doors closing in the hotel. Loved the fact that the St Charles streetcar ran in front of the hotel. The hotel is attached to a banking/office tower which faces St Charles Ave. The office tower was complete with banks, stores, food court and a UPS store, which came in handy for shipping purchases home. Canal street was one block over, and Carondelet turns into Bourbon on the other side of Canal St. We were able to walk everywhere or catch at streetcar with ease. Felt very safe walking to and from this location. I would defiantly stay at this location again.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with spacious, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: Wilson60
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very centrally located to the French Quarter and about a twenty minute walk from the River Walk and Convention Center. My room was quite large and spacious-everything was very clean. The bed was comfortable, and the free in-room wireless was nice to have. The only negative was that the large windows overlooked other hotel rooms, so it was necessary to keep the drapes drawn. The staff was very nice and helpful-the doorman lended me his umbrella for the evening when it started to pour, and the breakfast attendant went out her way to help me find a yogurt for breakfast when I arrived to breakfast late. Overall, this is a very comfortable, clean place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “They need a new breakfast supplier”
Reviews.Author: irishiz5
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was fine. It was very clean. I wasn't crazy about the bed - just alright on that. The breakfast wasn't that great at all (I do want to say at this point though, that both women working as hostesses were wonderful, friendly and helpful and the food review is absolutely NO reflection on them). There was one hot dish at each breakfast. Scrambled eggs mixed with cheese on day 1 (weird consistency). Eggs with bacon and cheese on an English muffin the next day (I don't eat bacon, and I don't like pre-made sandwiches). Day 3 featured small waffle squares - pretty much tasteless. The bananas were usually green. The bagels were like I'd get at a local grocery store, same with the pastries. I really like the breakfast at Country Inn and Suites, it is always really good. I would have expected a little more from this hotel. It was passable, and that was it. I had read reviews before I got there in which some people didn't care for the breakfast, and I figured they were picky or used to really nice restaurants all of the time, but I have to agree with them. I do want to make a note that they advertise that they have "microfridges". I just thought they meant small fridges, but apparently it's a brand of some sort, which is a small refrigerator and a small microwave. So that was nice. The small couch was not comfortable at all. We did miss having a pool. I wished I would have booked at another place for that reason alone. If you're not interested in the breakfast or a pool, the rooms were nice and big and clean, so you would probably be happy here. Close enough to the French Quarter to walk home after a few, and also, a CVS about a block down that has snacks and liquor.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: RaginCajun1
Reviews.Content: The location of this property is just great. It is just off the French Quarter and the St. Charles street car passes right in front. This gives easy access to the Garden district as well as the city park/zoo area. The hotel could be considered a 4 star at a 2 star price for the area. The rooms are a nice size and well appointed. The staff are very friendly and helpful. The parking is expensive, $29, but the vallet's are accommodating. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property on the edge of the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: MarkDavis
Reviews.Content: This was a HH rewards stay for the Jazz Festival. The building was built in the 1920s by Daniel Burnham, about 14 stories tall. Beautiful old buildings that was converted to a hotel, I think, in the mid-1990's. I was on the Eleventh floor and it was VERY quiet. No street noise or noise from other rooms. The ceiling height was amazing and our room was very spacious. The decor was nice and comfortable. Internet wireless signal was strong. Room and halls were very clean! Other Pros: St Charles Streetcar stops right in front of the hotel, so it's easy to get a ride to the Quarter, Garden District and the Zoo. There are about a zillion great restaurants in walking distance, not to mention bars. For the record, Carondelet Street becomes Bourbon street when you cross Canal. Cons: Valet parking seemed to be the only option to park a car. However, I was there 3 nights and they only charged me $26. And when I requested the car the staff was very quick to pull it to the curb. The bathroom was puzzling. It was huge, but very outdated. I say it was puzzling as it didn't match the rest of the upscale feeling of the hotel. It was clean and usable, but was very ugly, yellow floor tile, yellow walls, formica clad vanity, etc. No pictures on the walls, no updated lighting. Don't get me wrong, it wasn't an issue, just kinda surprising. Overall, I loved the place and the location. I wouldn't hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, clean, friendly staff, great breakfastâ€¦We highly recommend!!!”
Reviews.Author: Travelor2232
Reviews.Content: I can't tell you how happy we were at this Hampton Inn. We originally checked-in to a boutique hotel just around the corner that was recommended by a friend, however, we were stunned at the terrible condition of that hotel (I'll be writing a review about how terrible that hotel was once I gush about our wonderful experience here). I travel for business and stay in Hampton Inns fairly often, so my first thought was "We can't stay in this dump, let's see if we can find a Hampton Inn." Sure enough, there was a Hampton Inn right around the corner. We walked into the lobby and the staff was extremely friendly, not just at check-in, but throughout our entire stay. The room was very clean, spacious, and updated. The mattress and pillows were very comfortable. The best part was the breakfast! We paid a little more, about $10 more a night, to stay at the Hampton Inn than at the prior hotel we originally had checked into, however, with the cost of breakfast in the city, the breakfast at the Hampton Inn easily paid for the difference, plus it was 100 times nicer! Don't expect a full warm buffet or anything, but plenty of choices to easily fill you up including fresh fruit, yogurt, a few warm items, cereal, bagels/bread/muffins, etc. Plus they had two â€œbreakfast hostessesâ€� who are constantly keeping the entire buffet stocked and tidy all morning. The location is perfect too, we didnâ€™t rent a car, but this location is about two blocks from the French quarter, so you get a nice quiet nights sleep, but you can walk to the French quarter in just minutes. Itâ€™s also convenient to the casino, aquarium, and tons of restaurants. It's the best value for the money. My husband and I were more than satisfied with the Hampton Inn and would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, except during Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: leslietfj
Reviews.Content: My husband is a diamond member with Hilton and we had 2 free nights, so when friends invited us to a renewal of wedding vows in New Orleans, it was a no brainer, even if the location was lousy. Well it wasn't lousy. It was fine, except that during parade season getting across Canal Street can be tricky on foot and impossible in a cab. We were afraid we'd be late to an event because we planned for a cab ride and ended up having to walk to the restaurant. It wasn't a huge deal and probably only took a few more minutes and a little more wear and tear on the feet, but maybe a little more stress than we wanted. As far as the hotel itself, it has a few things to recommend it over the hotels in the district. The first being it's not in the district. It's quieter, there's no barf on the sidewalk and there's no one yelling to show us your [-]. And being on the 9th floor as we were, we had zero issues with road noise. All of my friends had issues with outside noises while they tried to sleep. We got a great recommendation for a restaurant from the guy at the front desk (Acme Oyster House... it's a must), and our wake up call came as requested. Going against it, the public areas smelled oddly of pee. I think maybe the carpets in the rooms have been replaced but not in the hallways. We also had a fabulous view of a brick wall. On the other hand, we spent about 4 seconds a day in the room, so the view wasn't really an issue for us. If you're in New Orleans for the parades (the big parades with the floats), this is a block off the route, so not bad. The "walking parades" (as I think they're called) through the district are of course not nearby, being that the hotel is not in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great location”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! It's in a historic building renovated to be a hotel so the rooms are huge and meticulously appointed. The renovation is fairly recent so it is fresh. The bathroom had a big counter and very bright lights. The bed was very comfortable and nicely decked out in comfy pillows. I was in a corner room that had five windows! It's just a two block walk to Canal Street and the French Quarter so we could walk to many great dinner spots from the hotel. I'm always going to stay here when in NOLA. It was really, really nice. And that's saying something because I've stayed in a zillion hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in this Hampton”
Reviews.Author: PatBeaumont
Reviews.Content: We needed a hotel room at the last minute, so being a Hilton Honors member, I called the 800 line to find this hotel and book a reservation. No double rooms were available, just a king room/study with a couch/fold-out bed, which was acceptable. When my son went to go to bed, the sheets on the couch were dirty, and there was trash in the bed. It was after midnight, so he ended up sleeping on the couch. The next morning, I informed the front desk, who laughed and told me they would tell housekeeping because that was unacceptable. The room was changed, but the couch was still not cleaned and my son didn't want to sleep on it. Upon packing our items to leave, I discovered a bag of our dirty laundry was missing. I contacted the front desk to see if Housekeeping had picked it up by mistake, thinking it was laundry, and they said they would leave a note for them the following morning. The morning manager had not been appraised of the situation and Housekeeping was unaware of our items, so they are now lost. I called 1-800-Hampton to inform them of our unsatisfactory stay, and was told to wait 72 hours for someone to contact me. I reminded them of the 100% satisfaction guarantee and was again told to wait, and give them 3 days to contact me. I told them there was nothing that could change my opinion of the stay, but was again told to wait 72 hours to let them resolve the matter. I'm not quite sure how this will be "resolved," but I am disappointed that Hampton is not honoring their 100% satisfaction guarantee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: NorthwestTraveler111
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed for five nights. Our room was very large and quiet. We never heard another guest.. The location is just a couple blocks from the FQ and right on the streetcar line to the Garden District. The breakfast bar has a nice variety of items and is located in a very comfortable setting. All in all, I would not hesitate to stay at this Hampton Inn again. It is a great value.

Reviews.Title: “Nice quiet hotel near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Geoggirl
Reviews.Content: A friend and I recently stayed here during the Voodoo Experience in City Park. Hotel was clean and quiet. Front desk was very helpful with any request we had. Room had two queen beds and was very spacious. Beds were very comfortable and we both loved the very cozy comforters. Hotel is in a quiet area and is just a short walk to the craziness of Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Rose-Grows
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Hampton Inn New Orleans near the French quarter. We were only there for two nights. The hotel was clean, the rates good, the rooms quite large, and the hotel employees were friendly. If I ever have to return to New Orleans, I would recommend the Hampton

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay!”
Reviews.Author: ladoug
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, especially for families. The rooms we got had 2 queen size beds in each one. (Not just doubles!). Rooms were large and spacious. Same for bathroom. Beds were comfortable. The hotel has small lobby...but why pay for that! Great location, excellent staff and easy valet parking. Can walk, take trolley or drive to French Quarter. Will stay again on next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: Newburgh_IndianaRudy
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hampton Inn. If you are doing a lot of touring this is a great place to stay. Very close to Bourbon. Just cross Canal street and you are there. Would highly recommend Tours by Isabelle! VIP tours and the Haunted History tours of the St Louis cemetery 1. The Gumbo Shop--was a nice surprise (restaurant). We were pleased with our hotel room very clean! We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ddurcs74
Reviews.Content: Very helpful front desk staff. Extra towels brought right to the room upon request. Clean rooms , pretty decent size for New Orleans rooms. Fantastic location, bourbon is right across canal street so you are close to the fun , but dont have to hear it all night. Located on the St. Charles Streetcar line. Great place to stay, look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: BrandonBethy
Reviews.Content: Had a king deluxe room, was sufficient in size and cleanliness. Had a mini fridge and microwave in room, plenty of stations on cable. Hotel has good security. The free breakfast was adequate and a plus for saving $. We liked the location on Carondolet as it is two blocks off Canal and bourbon streets so it is quiet. The only thing we did not find easily was food in the evening within the blocks surrounding the hotel. We will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, awesome location for the money”
Reviews.Author: coachgrrl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel after a cruise. We have 3 kids ages 10, 11 and 14. Our room was large and was able to fit an extra cot without diffeculty. The bed were very comfortable and the room was clean. The am staff, was very helpful, one of the lady desk clerks mapped us out a great walking route thru the french quater down to cafe du monde to walk with our kids. Breakfast was good with several choices. Excellent location 2 blocks to the french quarter, but none of the noise. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Average urban Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: dweebe
Reviews.Content: The Hampton Inn Downtown New Orleans is an average urban Hampton Inn location. I don't mind staying there and could recommend it as a second level choice when other hotels are unavailable or two expensive. The rooms are nice but a bit on the small side. However they are of decent quality and the staff works hard even in the face of Mardi Gras madness. The location is good since the hotel is two blocks west of Canal Street and the French Quarter. So attractions are a quick walk, but you're not right in the heart of the madness.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Sugar Bowl”
Reviews.Author: CrazyDog5301976
Reviews.Content: The reservations team was very gracious in helping me book for the Georgia Sugar Bowl game. Parking/Valet was very courteous. When we were checking in, our room was "not available" ? but the guy at the desk were really nice at helping check our baggage and giving directions/restaurant suggestions. Maids did not service our room well, did not understand what I was saying and their manager seemed to be very upset with us still being in the room the next night (even though we had requested a late check-out timing) The night auditor was also very helpful when we ran into a problem the first night there with maid service. The girl who checked us out was very nice in calling us our cars.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: brooky224
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was comprabale to other Hampton Inns I have stayed in. The room was not huge, but was plenty big enough for 2. Nice bathroom, although not yet with the special shower heads that most other Hampton Inns have. Comfy bed as usual. The view was not good at all... a brick wall 3 feet from our window! But this did not really bother me, as we were not in the room that much. The staff are very accommadating, and I am sure that if you call ahead and request a view, it would not be a problem. I got a good rate on the Hampton Inn website, but then found a lower one hidden away on another part of the site. When I called and asked if they could change my rate, it was done with no problem. The location of this hotel is ideal. It is about 2 blocks from Bourbon Street and the French Quarter, and an easy walk to Jackson Square, the river front, the french market, and anything else you might want to see in that area. That means you have very easy access to the French Quarter without the nosie of late night revelry. Overall, I had a good experience with this hotel. New Orleans is a great city and they need our help to rebuild. There was even a letter in the hotel room thanking us for rebuilding New Orleans "one hotel room at a time." I was happy to do my small part and would do it again. I have heard nightmares about security in the city, but I was out until around midnight a couple of evenings and there was a heavy police presence wherever I went. Just use common sense and you should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Better than you would expect”
Reviews.Author: Patrick121
Reviews.Content: This Hampton is better than your average Hampton, with a decent free breakfast and happy hour on the 4th floor. The corner rooms are great, with tall windows and spacious living areas. The regular rooms can be a little small and all of them are a little raggedy in spots, but New Orleans has always been a little raggedy. Where this hotel truly shines is proximity to the French Quarter. The hotel is situated one block of Canal street at the top of what becomes Bourbon Street (Carondalet Street). Even if Bourbon Street is not your final destination, the hotel sits on the streetcar tracks leading uptown and is a block from the new line that runs up Canal to City Park. By no means is this the fanciest hotel, nor is it a hidden gem but the rates are typically good and it is above average for a Hampton.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hampton Inn customer service experience ever!”
Reviews.Author: travelgal95
Reviews.Content: First let me say that I really enjoy staying at the Hampton Inn because the rooms are usually spacious, the service is great and the free breakfast is a plus. However, upon my arrival, I received horrible customer service as if I were inconveniencing the front desk employee. Initially, it was unclear where the elevators were so I ended up heading to the elevators in the office building and told by someone that I was going the wrong way. You have to use your room key to access all floors, except the lobby, which can be a little annoying. The lobby area and the elevators are a little seedy. Definitely not up to the standards of other Hampton Inn hotels The room is also very small compared to other Hampton Inn hotels. I stayed in a room with a king sized bed and the bathroom is one of the smallest I have seen. It contained a stand up shower (and no bathtub) There was no spacious closet like I'm used to. The TV, closet space, and bureau were all part of one big armoire in the room. I called to schedule a wake up call at 6:30am, which I never received. Then I asked the front desk to call a cab for me. I allowed myself plenty of time. However, even when I got downstairs, I still had to wait for an additional 20 minutes, almost arriving late to my morning meeting. For the first time ever, I decided to use the 100% Customer Satsifaction guarantee. I called several times and left my complaint with an employee who said she would pass it onto the asst. manager. However I never received a return phone call so I called the hotel and reached her and she said they would credit my account. She also hoped that I would come and stay at that hotel again. She is a new asst. manager and says that she is looking forward to improving the customer service at that location, which is definitely something to keep in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn on Bourbon Street!!”
Reviews.Author: maliknmegan_lee
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Hampton Inn on Carondolet for our summer couple vacation. It is in a great location 2 blocks from the French Quarter. As a matter of fact, when you cross Canal St. it turns into Bourbon Street, right at the heart of the FQ. We slept great because we were far enough from the partying. We loved the bed! The room was beautiful and historical. Our service was good and we had an authentic New Orleans feel all for $79 a night! Great security you have to use your room key to get up in the elevator. You have a coffee maker, microwave and fridge in your room. Some issues: Don't be fooled by reviews that say you will get more than a continental breakfast. That is what it is, we now call it Snackfast. There were 2 hot items a day, but they weren't great. French toast sticks, fried eggs, filler sausage patties and sausage links, it varied from day to day. You will most likely have to follow up with breakfast or brunch somewhere else. Also be aware that the price of your room and then some will be held immediately on your card, the day you check in. So take that out of your trip budget. The TV was kinda fuzzy but we weren't in the room much. Overall it was a great stay at a bargain. I would stay again, however being a breakfast lover, I'm inclined to look for a stay with a FULL breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: uscandy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hampton Inn for four nights in late March/early April and I have to say I was more than a bit hesitatnt before we arrived. I am happy to report that ALL of my fears were unfounded. This was my first trip to New Orleans and I fell in love with the city. LOCATION: The French Quarter is only two short blocks away. Yes, many of the buildings are boarded up, but even when walking home late at night, we felt safe. Once you cross Canal, you only have one short block that is quiet and then you are within view of the Hampton and the neighboring Holiday Inn. This isn't to say that you shouldn't be aware, but don't worry about taking a cab the two short blocks. The hotel doesn't have many shops and those that do close early, but there is a Walgreens on the corner of Carondelet (sp?) and Canal for drinks, toiletries, snacks, etc. HOTEL: We had a room on the 5th floor ... which was a combination of smoking and non-smoking rooms. While this seemed odd to us, other than a bit of smell in the hallway, our non-smoking room was fine. The room size is average, large compared to New York for example. The closet was decent sized and we loved the fridge and microwave. The linens were great. NOTE: My one complaint was the housekeeping staff. Several times we came back to the room around 3pm and the room was still not cleaned. Our coffee pot was only cleaned once and our linens never changed, even when requested. BREAKFAST: The breakfast was great! Someone else commented there were no hot items. We had at least one hot item every morning and a nice assortment of breads, cereals, yogurt, etc. This coupled with the free wireless access in our room was a great perk! The dining room itself was pleasant as well. OTHER: We took a cab to the airport on our way back ... be sure to allow yourself at least 5 minutes to catch a cab. They seem to be infrequent. I am also going to write review for some restaurants (Muriels, Tujagues, Cafe Benet, Johnny's PoBoy), and a few touristy activities (Cajun Style Swamp Tours). Overall ... while there is still a lot of rebuilding left to do, I can truly say I left my heart in New Orleans. Everyone I encountered there was friendly and still so proud of their city. As our carriage driver told us, the only way for New Orleans to recover, is for people like yourselves to keep coming.

Reviews.Title: “Well Worth It”
Reviews.Author: crackofdawn
Reviews.Content: We stayed on St. Patricks' eve and enjoyed the hotel. It was well worth the $108 we paid and had a huge room and bath on the corner of the hotel, 10th, floor as well. We did the morning continental b'fast and found several hot items, so no real complaints about that either. The location which is 1 block west of Canal street is fine as Bourbon street picks up from Carrondelet once you get across Canal. We had an excellent dinner at the Palace Cafe, a Brennan restaurant, that was about 3 blocks south on Canal. We'd definitely return for a night or two at this Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Patqulyn
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a seven-night stay at this hotel and was very disappointed. Uppon arrival, everything seemed so wonderful, the two-bedroom and bathroom was huge (high ceilings, would fit a family of 6 comfortable with cots). Since there was only two of us we switched to a king bed. The room and bathroom was very small (WARNING: rooms significantly differ in size). As the stay progressed, service got worse. Housekeeping missed cleaning the room twice, and when the came back, they just folded the sheets and took the dirty towels... not even replacing them. If we needed everything, we had to wait an hour for it (that is if they ever brought it up). Another dissapointing aspect was the free breakfast. Don't expect to see eggs, bacon, ham, sausage, etc., everything is cold, only cereal, juice, coffee, and stale begals. The only really good things that came from the stay was its location, free dry-cleaning, and discounted rate (I had before we checked-in). To sum it up: bad service, rude and lazy housekeeping, room size differences, and lack of features (no in-room movies either). If you choose to stay, do so only if you have a really discounted rate (i.e. <$100).

Reviews.Title: “An Okay Stay”
Reviews.Author: RedHeadGo
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a two night stay at this property. Although the website states it is one block from the French Quarter, is a bit closer to three. The area where the hotel resides contains other hotels and office buildings, unfortunately there are no real restaurants or shops for one-two blocks from the property. There are some retail/clothing stores in the lobby (if you walk past it), however they were always closed by the time I got back to the hotel in the evening. You will find that a lot of the shops and restaurants in New Orleans and surrounding areas have limited hours, especially when you go outside the French Quarter. Even the Shops at Canal closes at 6pm, although the movie theatre and a few eateries were open past then. There is such a shortage of employees due to not having anywhere to live in so many areas of the city. I was able to tour the area with a local employee from my office and it is heartbreaking. If you stay in the FQ, you really won't see much of this, however if you head over to the 9th Ward, Lakefront, East New Orleans, etc., etc. you have to wonder how the city will recover. Is very upsetting. The area was just so-so. It is close enough to the French Quarter, however was close to Canal and Bourbon and really wasn't close enough to what I wanted to see (Jackson Square, Cafe de Monde). If I were to stay again, I would choose either a much newer hotel, or stay more in the nicer part of the French Quarter. As nightfall came, I really didn't feel safe walking back from the French Quarter alone, as a female. The streets are pretty much empty and dark. Luckily I found a couple walking their dog that I talked to on the way and was fine. I did see some National Guard, but not really where I was. I did see a lot of NOPD. My room was in the corner, a King Study and the first thing that hit me was the smell. It was a musty smell, could have been because the furniture was older, could be the zillions drapes on the windows, could have been the window panes, it was just not a fresh smelling room and really just smelled old. The bathroom was decently clean, however the grout really needed a touch-up. Water pressure was so-so. Was decently clean. There is a cabinet in the room that features a 25-27" TV (reception was just okay), a microwave, fridge, safe, two small closets with an iron and ironing board. The drawers are actually located on the nightstand (which took me a night to figure out). The carpet was so-so, again, could have been cleaned or replaced. The sofa was pretty warn, had a stain or two. The computer desk was fine, adequate lighting and the chair was very comfortable. Free internet worked well. The air conditioner, as described, is a bit of a pain. When I came into the room it was set on 60 (old school dial) and medium. It was freezing. When I went to bed I put it at 70. It felt more like the upper 70's and was warm when I was sleeping. So, second night left it on 60 and was better, but a bit too cold. I would aim for 65! Bedding was not the new Hampton bedding yet, so your generic icky comforter and blanket. They do give you plenty of pillows and the bed was very firm. Staff was always very pleasant, including housekeeping and maintenance. Wake up calls were always on time. Valet Parking was easy, but very expensive, with tax: $29. There are lots/garages very close to the hotel. If you are traveling on your own dime and don't mind walking a block or so, I would see what else is available. I didn't eat the breakfast, is located on the 4th floor, however they do have my favorite breakfast bags at the front desk. Those are a life-saver when heading out to visit the office. There is an exercise room on 14 that had a lot of equipment and a weight machine. Vending machines with snacks on 4 and 14, other floors have ice/soda. Overall, the rate was excellent at $80.10 and if they could spruce up the rooms a bit and somehow get the musty smell out, would have been a nicer stay. Once they get the Hampton Bedding, that may help a bit too. If you aren't super-picky, this is a fine stay, if you have allergies, I would think twice. And PS.... while you are there, make sure to tip often and generously. The people in the city need our help.

Reviews.Title: “Even post-Katrina, an excellent choice”
Reviews.Author: alabamabella
Reviews.Content: Staff was extremely easy to work with (changed our room selection at our request upon arrival). Hotel rooms are amply sized -- lots of space, nice sized bathroom with extra counter space. Refrigerator in the room was great to store leftvers from all the great meals we ate. Continental breakfast has both hot and cold items, a nice buffet each morning. Very safe with key access needed just to use the elevator. Valets are relatively fast and very courteous. Housekeeping was accomodating, cleaning our room each day upon our requested time (we had to work around our children's nap schedules.) Convenient location. You'd never know this hotel had significant flooding after the hurricane, and it really compares with some of the nicer hotels i have ever stayed in. The downsides: no restaurant, therefore no room service available. There are a few eateries on the 2nd floor food court, but they have very limited hours (mostly lunch and no weekends). Bring everything you need; there is no convenience store or hotel gift shop to buy forgotten items. (Though there is a convenience store a couple of blocks away.) Well worth the value and will exceed your expectations for a Hampton Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn delivers !”
Reviews.Author: jaonyc
Reviews.Content: Inspite of the conditions in New Orleans, the Hampton Inn did everything possible to make my stay pleasant. Many services are available on a limited basis, at this hotel in the heart of downtown with incredibly easy access to French Quarter (which is up and running).

Reviews.Title: “Great location with good perks”
Reviews.Author: Citkatt
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a great location. You are just two blocks away from the french quater. I always felt safe walking back to the hotel at night, with key entry after 10. The rooms are some of the biggest in NO and the breakfast offered is great. Different hot plates each morning and a variety of pasties, fruits, cerial, and breads. The only thing that made this hotel a 4 was the room never really got cold, it got cool but not cold enough. The front desk was great and very helpful. Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, afew problems”
Reviews.Author: Whatbob
Reviews.Content: My 2nd stay here and this higher floor room was much more worn and smaller. It was a deluxe. The void where a fridge once was in the bedroom furniture is an eyesore and a bit annoying when it turns out that they have about 4 fridges for the whole hotel. We were there 3 nights and our requested fridge was never available. High floors do not mean views as the wall below the window juts out and only the builing opposite is to be seen, the street car and the street could not be seen at all. Overall the location makes it but I felt this hotel is slipping a bit.

Reviews.Title: “Great find.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel had big clean rooms, good continental breakfast. Add to that: friendly service. The location is superb! Within walking distance from everything. We booked directly online with the hotel and took advantage of our AAA membership and got a great rate in our opinion. We won't have to look any further on our next trip to the Big Easy. Superb.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn F.Q. Ups and Downs”
Reviews.Author: Suebjazz
Reviews.Content: The excellent postings on Tripadvisor convinced me to book a room at the Hampton Inn F.Q. May 20-24, 2005 for my vacation. Unfortunately, the Hampton Inn fell short. The King Study room was large, but it was dreary, dark and kind of outdated. Everything is gold! The bathroom was large, but again, old and outdated. Some of the amenities (i.e. continental breakfast and over-sized TV in the room) were nice. It's not as close to Bourbon street or the F.Q. as I thought. You have to cross Canal. I would recommend this hotel for business travel, but not for your vacation. It lacked a certain quality and convenience that some of the other New Orleans hotels offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Very friendly staff. Great location close to the French Quarter. Clean rooms and tasty breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “2 Hotels for the price of one! Wonderful!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We want to take this opportunity to thank everyone at both the Downtown Hampton and the Convention Center location for making our stay in New Orleans a memorable one. While arriving at midnight to find there was no room in the inn may not be the best way to start our trip, the effort on the part of everyone involved helped turn a negative into a huge positive. And this courteous attitude continued for our entire stay. We will certainly be back to New Orleans and will be staying at either of your hotels. Great location and a wonderful hotel. If one is not too concerned with being too close to the Quarter the Convention Center is a beautiful hotel!!! Thank You again, Lynn & Bill Collins San Clemente, CA

Reviews.Title: “Delightful, Delightful, Delighful”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I can't wait to go back. This Hotel was far from what I expected. The entire staff could not have been more helpful. Normally when I am away from home, I can't wait to get back home. Not this stay, the Hotel was so comfortable it was like being at home. Every single staff member is a credit to their profession.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great location! The hotel is located in the Central Business District, which is safe and fairly quiet at night. However, you only have to walk to blocks and you are on Bourbon street / French Quarter. The hotel was pretty on par with other Hampton inns. Clean, comfortable rooms with good self serve breakfast. The staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Just as good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: mzubler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just as great as all of the reviews that we read before staying there. It met and exceeded our expectations. The staff was very courteous and extremely helpful. The whole place, including our room, was very clean and tastefully decorated. The location is great, being just outside the French Quarter. The breakfast buffet was excellent with a good selection. The only negative was the valet parking on our first day, where it took us over an hour to retrieve our car. When we complained about this they refunded our parking fee for that day. I can't think of another negative thing to say about this place and I would highly recommend it and will certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn, Carondelet. Simply the best!”
Reviews.Author: hardworking19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton April 10-13. This hotel is located just 2 blocks from the French Quarter (in fact, Carondelet turns into Burbon St. across Canal St.). Check-in was a breeze. The bell staff met my car at the curb, and took my luggage and valet parked my car. The front desk staff was very friendly and attentive. In fact check-in took about 3 minutes total! My room was large, spacious and very nicely appointed. The staff was very helpful with directions and suggestions for areas of interest and dining tips. Everything was within walking distance, and during my 3 day stay, my car never left the garage! Probably my best hotel experience in years.

Reviews.Title: “Hampton Inn goes upscale!”
Reviews.Author: awelch2000
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Hampton Inn Downtown in early March 2005 and was VERY pleasantly surprised. I travel frequently for business and as I drove up it was immediately clear that this was a different type of Hampton Inn. Beautiful old building, valet parking, and a short walk to the French Quarter. My room was much larger than I'm used to at a Hampton Inn, was spotless, and felt more like a higher-end chain. Staff was responsive and very helpful. I'll definitely stay here again on future trips to the Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay During Mardi Gras”
